description: Aromas of graphite, black olive, dark chocolate and herbal berry fruits get this Petit Verdot off on the right foot. In the mouth, high acidity makes for palate sharpness while also jacking up plum and currant flavors. A spicy, herbal-tasting finish runs long due to raw acidity.
title: Don Tony Perez 2014 Gran Reserva Petit Verdot (Curicó Valley)

description: Earthy, rubbery dark-berry aromas feed into a lean palate supported by drawing tannins. Like the nose, this tastes herbal and leafy, with generic berry flavors and a touch of mushroom. The finish is light and short.
title: Creación 2013 Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Melon, banana and bath oil aromas announce a layered, citrusy palate, with simple flavors of orange and white pepper. The finish is citric in flavor but not overly sharp in feel.
title: La Playa 2014 Estate Series Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Briny, sea foam aromas sit on top of papaya and corn on this oaky, resiny Chardonnay. Woody flavors are up front and immediate, with secondary flavors of clove and peach that end with sawdust.
title: Casas del Bosque 2013 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Less adequate than in the past. The wine lacks aromatic zest and pungency before showing tart apple and ultimately vegetal flavors. Canned pea notes are prevalent.
title: Santa Rita 2010 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Smells distinctly like juniper, hot brush and stemmy black fruit. The palate feels tough and stemmy, and the flavors are bitter and weedy. Just doesn't seem ripe. Weak for Chile's de facto Malbec leader.
title: Viu Manent 2010 Estate Collection Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: Heavy and globular on the nose, then mulchy, salinic and disjointed for the rest of the ride. Awkward and lemony feeling, with herbal berry flavors, tartness and just not much Pinot pizzazz. A jumbled wine that does not shine.
title: Morandé 2008 Edición Limitada Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Nutty and sweaty smelling. There's life and acidity to the palate, but the flavors of pickled fruits turn bitter and seem less than clean. Doesn't start that well and never improves.
title: TerraNoble 2010 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Not all that clean or clear up front, with aromas of sweated onion and field greens. The palate is fairly sharp and tangy, with pickled flavors of sour apple and lemon. Citrusy on the finish.
title: William Cole 2010 Albamar Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Not all that clean or clear up front, with aromas of sweated onion and field greens. The palate is fairly sharp and tangy, with pickled flavors of sour apple and lemon. Citrusy on the finish.
title: William Cole 2010 Albamar Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Herbal and leathery smelling, with a grassy quality to the bouquet. Feels choppy and tannic, with jumbled, stewy flavors that turn more herbal and hot on the finish. Entirely underwhelming.
title: Anakena 2009 Single Vineyard Carmenère (Peumo)

description: One of the best value-priced, big and rich wines you're likely to find. The nose impresses with potent blackberry, cedar and marzipan aromas, and the palate bridges the gap between power and elegance. Tastes great, with herbal black cherry and cola leading the way. Very ripe but really well made.
title: Lapostolle 2008 Casa Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: One of the best value-priced, big and rich wines you're likely to find. The nose impresses with potent blackberry, cedar and marzipan aromas, and the palate bridges the gap between power and elegance. Tastes great, with herbal black cherry and cola leading the way. Very ripe but really well made.
title: Lapostolle 2008 Casa Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Starts out foxy and mossy, with leather, char, earth and herbal notes. The palate is nothing if not saturated and big, and the flavors run toward baked, meaty black fruits. Quite roasted and rich, with toasty oak on the finish and darkness throughout. Not the best Altaïr but still a fine Chilean red blend.
title: Altaïr 2006 Altaïr Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Starts out foxy and mossy, with leather, char, earth and herbal notes. The palate is nothing if not saturated and big, and the flavors run toward baked, meaty black fruits. Quite roasted and rich, with toasty oak on the finish and darkness throughout. Not the best Altaïr but still a fine Chilean red blend.
title: Altaïr 2006 Altaïr Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Aromas of radiator dust, melon, apple cider and minerals are intriguing and suggest good quality. A minerally, citric, chiseled palate offers flavors of crushed vitamins, tart persimmon and salty sea brine. Saltiness comes back on a minerally finish.
title: Loma Larga 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dry and reedy smelling, with juicy berry-cherry aromas and flavors. The wine is snappy, zesty and juicy, with accents of cocoa and pepper. Clean, simple Cabernet with ample pop and freshness.
title: Morandé 2009 Pionero Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Earthy and damp smelling, with chunky black cherry and olive aromas. The palate has a slightly choppy feel and then spicy, sweet flavors of herbs and blackberry. Finishes a little burnt and bitter, but overall there's enough sweetness and ripeness to offset any herbal qualities.
title: Miguel Torres 2009 Santa Digna Reserve Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: The first Pinot in Undurraga's Terroir Hunter series is lean, tart and zesty, but also clean and pleasing in its own right. Tea and dried cherry aromas yield to a spunky, lean palate of sharp raspberry and orange peel flavors. Finishes light but clean, with tartness.
title: Undurraga 2009 T.H. Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: A little minty, raisiny and flat on the nose, but still it's appealing. The palate has a condensed, syrupy feel and soft, semisweet flavors of red berry mixed with herbs and pepper. Spicy and a touch hollow on the finish, but still a good value Cab to drink now.
title: Quasar 2007 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Clean yet dilute on the bouquet, with touches of lime and grassiness. The palate, however, is kind of heavy and honeyed, a direct reflection of its warm Maipo roots. Tastes sweet and creamy but without much zesty fruit. Maybe a little too soft and candied, but still pretty good.
title: Santa Ema 2010 Selected Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: The 2005 vintage of this Cabernet-Carmenère blend is dark as night, thick as a side of beef, and sweet like a dessert. Licorice, molasses, graphite and blackberry share the unctuous nose, while the palate is tannic, rich and tastes like baked black fruits, coffee and chocolate pudding. Bordering on syrupy in its ripeness, so drink sooner rather than later.
title: Altaïr 2005 Sideral Red (Rapel Valley)

description: The 2005 vintage of this Cabernet-Carmenère blend is dark as night, thick as a side of beef, and sweet like a dessert. Licorice, molasses, graphite and blackberry share the unctuous nose, while the palate is tannic, rich and tastes like baked black fruits, coffee and chocolate pudding. Bordering on syrupy in its ripeness, so drink sooner rather than later.
title: Altaïr 2005 Sideral Red (Rapel Valley)

description: Tomato leaf, red bell pepper and dry spice aromas overrun the fruit, and in the mouth it's rather tart and acidic for the grape type. Flavors of cherry tomato, red plum and green herbs are good but sharp, while the finish features oak in the form of vanilla. More fresh and tart than most Carmenères.
title: Botalcura 2007 La Porfia Grand Reserve Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: Pretty honest on the nose, where it's mostly melony, peachy fruit and no faux oak. The palate is on the sharp side, with blazing acidity and not much body to go with citrus and apple flavors. Hits you with a lot of juiciness and aggression but doesn't bring a lot of mouthfeel and complexity.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2010 Gran Reserva Cuvée Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)

description: Big, muscular and herbal, with olive, spice and driving black fruit aromas. The acidity is high-toned and elevated, so the palate is jumpy and electric, with raspberry and currant flavors. Delivers a jolt and tang, but overall the flavors and harmony are good.
title: William Cole 2008 Columbine Special Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Licorice, mint leaf, black pepper and a hint of tomato define the nose, while the palate has a regular, lightly choppy feel along with flavors of olive, herbal berry fruit and pepper. Dry and smooth on the finish, with lightness and good balance. Good Merlot for the price.
title: Viña Casablanca 2008 Cefiro Reseva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Plum, berry, licorice and balsamic aromas are earthy and classy. This feels chunky and heavy but not ponderous. Flavors of prune, rooty spices, mint and chocolate finish with mocha and fig notes. Enjoy this ripe, full-bodied wine anytime through 2017.
title: San Pedro 2010 Tierras Moradas Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Honeyed aromas of wheat bread and stone fruits are not as convincing as the wine's citrus, melon and honey flavors, which are supported by a full almost-sticky body. A creamy, chunky finish, like the palate, pulls up short of sticky.
title: Casas del Bosque 2013 Late Harvest Riesling (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dark, charred, lemony aromas of graphite, licorice and blackberry are horsey and baked. This blend of 85% Cab Sauv and 15% Cab Franc has an intense, blocky, pinching palate and heavy flavors of black fruits, resiny oak, spice and salt. A woody, tannic, raw feel to the finish creates a bumpy landing. Drink through 2021.
title: Santa Alba 2012 Family Collection Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

description: Dark, charred, lemony aromas of graphite, licorice and blackberry are horsey and baked. This blend of 85% Cab Sauv and 15% Cab Franc has an intense, blocky, pinching palate and heavy flavors of black fruits, resiny oak, spice and salt. A woody, tannic, raw feel to the finish creates a bumpy landing. Drink through 2021.
title: Santa Alba 2012 Family Collection Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

description: Creamy oak, herbal blackberry, vanilla and mild green notes make for an intriguing, spicy nose. A heavy, tannic palate brings the weight and thickness, while flavors of blackberry and boysenberry come with salty notes and a briny, herbal finish.
title: San Pedro 2012 1865 Single Vineyard Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Creamy oak, herbal blackberry, vanilla and mild green notes make for an intriguing, spicy nose. A heavy, tannic palate brings the weight and thickness, while flavors of blackberry and boysenberry come with salty notes and a briny, herbal finish.
title: San Pedro 2012 1865 Single Vineyard Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Solid berry and cassis aromas are a touch baked on the nose. This is firm, moderately tannic on the palate, with baked plum, blackberry, vanilla and spice flavors. A woody note of maple gains prominence on the finish.
title: Primus 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A small-production, artisan Syrah with a smoky, lush nose that unveils raisin and prune as it unfolds. The palate is saturated and jammy, with a layered, tannic mouthfeel and big berry, herb and oak flavors. Finishes with size, pepper and dark spice flavors. 250 cases made.
title: Polkura 2007 Block G+I Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Smells floral and foresty, with solid plum and cherry scents offset by rubber. Feels fresh and zesty, with semisharp acidity pushing bright flavors of raspberry, red plum and dry oak. Turns a touch more oaky late, as vanilla and coconut flavors rise up. From five grapes led by Carmenère.
title: Chono 2009 San Lorenzo Estate Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Apple and melony aromas rule the easygoing, tropical bouquet. Feels fresh and properly acidic, with pithy, citrusy flavors that vascillate between lime and nectarine. Feels good, bright and under control, with sweetness and citrus pith on the finish. 2,000 cases made.
title: Chilcas 2010 Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Compact and dark in style, with notes of shoe polish, coconut, rubber, violet and blackberry. It feels tannic and mildly abrasive, with blackened, ripe flavors of dark berry fruits backed by a peppery, spice-dominant finish. This blend of Carmenère, Syrah and Cabernet is oaky and big overall.
title: Koyle 2009 Royale Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Solid but generic berry fruit aromas are clean and come with herbal, minty edging. There's no shortage of acidity, so the palate has a sharp, crisp feel and tart, oaky flavors of berry and plum. Sheer, hard, tart and dry on the finish.
title: TerraNoble 2009 Reserva Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Solid but generic berry fruit aromas are clean and come with herbal, minty edging. There's no shortage of acidity, so the palate has a sharp, crisp feel and tart, oaky flavors of berry and plum. Sheer, hard, tart and dry on the finish.
title: TerraNoble 2009 Reserva Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Chunky and earthy on the nose, which is big but undistinguished. The palate is tight and high in acid, while the flavors of wood, mint and roasted berry fruits come with pepper and herbal accents. Dry and basic on the finish.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Reserve Barrel Select Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Snappy and high-toned on the nose, with citrus peel and sweaty notes. The palate is solid, with sweet mango flavors followed by a small wave of bitterness and astringency. Candied but still a touch bitter on the finish.
title: Los Molles 2009 Late Harvest Botrytis Reserva - 375 ml Muscat (Limarí Valley)

description: Tired red fruit lurks under the black-pepper and charred-oak flavors on the palate, though the woody, rustic mouthfeel is interesting. Nose is rather mute, with a little dried herb showing through.
title: La Palma 2000 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Perfectly pleasant, particularly as a by-the-glass pour, the Porta is medium-bodied and easy to drink. Black berries and plums compete with rustic oak flavors in the mouth; the bouquet offers a bizarre blend of anise, butter cookies and apricots.
title: Porta 2000 Reserve - Cabernet Sauvignon/Carmenere Red (Chile)

description: This lighter-style Cab offers berry-fruit and black-tea flavors, and nut and oak finish. It's an easy quaffer, but nothing to mull over.
title: Santa Carolina 1999 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Strong-like-bull blackberry flavors  follow dirt, oak and a little pepper on the nose—all of the above appear on the finish. It's not terribly lush or complex, but it gets the job done.
title: Echeverria 1999 Reserva Merlot (Chile)

description: Moutfilling though not necessarily nuanced, this Merlot offers blackberry, oak and earth flavors, and similar aromas. A great choice for casual circumstances or big gatherings.
title: La Palma 2001 Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: Roasted red berry and tangy woodsy notes on both the nose and on the palate. Finishes with more oak, plus a tart metallic-herbal note that is softened by chalky tannins.
title: Caliterra 2000 Syrah (Central Valley)

description: This medium-bodied Carmenère offers blackberry, oak and white-pepper flavors and herb, wood and blueberry aromas. Good for a group; will appeal to a wide audience.
title: Portal Del Alto 2000 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: This Cab-Carmenère blend's more of the olive-earth-tree-bark kind than the blackberry-and-oak variety; still, there's enough black berry fruit underneath the outdoorsy aromas and flavors. Finishes with lots of green herb, and a vegetal note.
title: Carmen 1999 Reserve - Carmenere/Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Maipo Valley)

description: This Leyda SB opens with textbook cool-climate aromas of snap pea, passion fruit and lime. A tangy pointy acidic palate deals the usual Leyda flavor suspects: citrus, bell pepper and jalapeño. This is consistent on the finish, but short.
title: Undurraga 2015 T.H. Terroir Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: This absurdly priced Carmenère is always one of Chile's best, and this vintage is just fine, with cherry, cassis, graphite, herb and eucalyptus-like green aromas. The palate is chunky and round in feel, with solid acidity and plump, herbal flavors of berry fruits, olive and spice. But what justifies a $235 price tag? You can be the judge.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Kai Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: This absurdly priced Carmenère is always one of Chile's best, and this vintage is just fine, with cherry, cassis, graphite, herb and eucalyptus-like green aromas. The palate is chunky and round in feel, with solid acidity and plump, herbal flavors of berry fruits, olive and spice. But what justifies a $235 price tag? You can be the judge.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Kai Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: This is classic Chilean Cabernet. It's intense in color, with herb, graphite, licorice and blackberry aromas. The palate is solid, maybe a touch tannic, with oaky, beefy flavors of black fruits, anise and herbs. A solid-feeling, wholesome finish with modest complexity is the final act. Drink now through 2020.
title: Echeverria 2009 Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: This is classic Chilean Cabernet. It's intense in color, with herb, graphite, licorice and blackberry aromas. The palate is solid, maybe a touch tannic, with oaky, beefy flavors of black fruits, anise and herbs. A solid-feeling, wholesome finish with modest complexity is the final act. Drink now through 2020.
title: Echeverria 2009 Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Even if this Cab shows eucalyptus on the nose along with asphalt and olive aromas, the bouquet is complex and true as far as high-end Chilean Cabs go. A saturated, syrupy body reflects a hot vintage, while baked flavors of earthy fruits, beef soup and chocolate qualify as stewy but tasty. A warm, flat finish says drink this Cabernet sooner rather than later.
title: Domus Aurea 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This big, muscular wine opens with a tidal wave of oaky coconut and vanilla aromas matched against tar, eucalyptus and brushy blackberry. The palate smacks down with tannic bite, while the midlevel is a bit amorphous. Plum, berry, carob and leafy flavors set up an oaky, herbal, saucy tasting finish. Drink now through 2018.
title: Carmen 2009 Gold Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This big, muscular wine opens with a tidal wave of oaky coconut and vanilla aromas matched against tar, eucalyptus and brushy blackberry. The palate smacks down with tannic bite, while the midlevel is a bit amorphous. Plum, berry, carob and leafy flavors set up an oaky, herbal, saucy tasting finish. Drink now through 2018.
title: Carmen 2009 Gold Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The nose is jammy and candied smelling, but it finds its stride and delivers aromas of licorice, leather and concentrated berry after airing. Crisp and fresh in the mouth, this has clacky tannins leading to lightly herbal flavors of tomato, thyme and wild berry. It shows some warmth on the long, solid finish. Drink now–2015.
title: Santa Carolina 2009 Dry Farming Carignan (Cauquenes Valley)

description: Solid berry aromas blend with notes of mild herb, mocha and sweet oak. The palate has good structure and feel, with creamy, oaky flavors of blackberry, cassis and vanilla. Dry, composed and medium-long on the finish, with freshness due to healthy acids. Contains 15% Malbec and Petit Verdot.
title: Koyle 2009 Royale Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a touch foxy and feral on the nose, but overall it's an attractive, aggressive wine, with sweaty leather and animal leanings but also a lot of solid fruit and power. It feels round, with a herbal flavor and a cookie note, and a long, juicy and toasty finish.
title: Casa Silva 2009 Gran Reserva Lolol Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Earthy, complex aromas of coffee, mocha, cherry and cassis set the stage for a fresh, clean mouthfeel and deep, satisfying flavors of cherry, chassis and spice. A toasty finish with mocha, herb and black-fruit flavors is in sync. Drink through 2021.
title: Apaltagua 2013 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Classic Cabernet aromas of cassis and boysenberry are steady on the nose. This is plush and mouthfilling, with good overall balance. Flavors of herbs, olive, chocolate, baking spices and blackberry are bright, healthy and end with notes of additional spices and herbs.
title: Château Los Boldos 2013 Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Classic Cabernet aromas of cassis and boysenberry are steady on the nose. This is plush and mouthfilling, with good overall balance. Flavors of herbs, olive, chocolate, baking spices and blackberry are bright, healthy and end with notes of additional spices and herbs.
title: Château Los Boldos 2013 Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Citrus and tropical-fruit aromas show snap in front of a racy palate. White pepper and grassy notes work the finish on this easygoing Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Concha y Toro 2014 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Loud, briny raspberry aromas are not shy and come with a note of latex. This is wide and blocky in feel, with heavy, baked flavors of raspberry and stewed plum. Oak spice and mild peppery bitterness on the finish are ponderous.
title: Casas del Bosque 2013 Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Lactic oak and minty green notes run with plum and berry aromas. This is hard as nails, with big tannins that grate along the sides of a round mouthfeel. Roasted, oaky berry flavors are dark and spicy, while woodspice and resin flavors steer a rubbery feeling finish.
designation: Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Single Vineyard
title: Viña Requingua 2012 Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Gritty, charred, spicy aromas muscle out black-fruit notes on a peppery bouquet. This feels acidic, while flavors of berry fruits come with oaky notes of carob and mint. A chunky, resiny finish closes this out.
title: Viña Maipo 2013 Vitral Reserva Carmenère (Chile)

description: Gritty, charred, spicy aromas muscle out black-fruit notes on a peppery bouquet. This feels acidic, while flavors of berry fruits come with oaky notes of carob and mint. A chunky, resiny finish closes this out.
title: Viña Maipo 2013 Vitral Reserva Carmenère (Chile)

description: Aromas of earth, tomato paste, Heinz ketchup and dust are saucy. This is drawing and tomatoey, with aggressive, saucy flavors of plum and cherry.
title: Ventisquero 2013 Grey Glacier Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Oaky aromas of sawdust vie with herbal, leafy notes on the nose of this Carmenère. Roasted black-plum flavors finish with grabby, rubbery tannins.
title: Santa Alicia 2013 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Oaky aromas of sawdust vie with herbal, leafy notes on the nose of this Carmenère. Roasted black-plum flavors finish with grabby, rubbery tannins.
title: Santa Alicia 2013 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Briny cherry and red-currant aromas are light. This feels sharp on the palate, with fresh flavors of red plum, tomato and a salty hint.
title: Millaman 2014 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Melony aromas come with a heavy blast of brine. This feels oily and marginal, with salty, briny flavors of orange and lime that finish disjointed before falling off.
title: La Playa 2014 Block Selection Tinga Reserve Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Rubbery, roasted berry aromas show on the nose. An astringent, tannic palate shows medicinal flavors of red plum and berry fruits along with savory notes and a shot of clove. The finish brings a salty and oaky note.
title: Aresti 2013 Special Release Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: The nose is faint and neutral. In the mouth, lemony acidity creates a pointy mouthfeel, while orange and lemon flavors finish bland despite getting a boost from citric acidity.
title: Gran Verano 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: The nose is faint and neutral. In the mouth, lemony acidity creates a pointy mouthfeel, while orange and lemon flavors finish bland despite getting a boost from citric acidity.
title: Gran Verano 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: This citrusy wine is all grapefruit, lime and citrus peel, with green notes poking through. Enjoyable, easy and varietally characteristic of Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Balduzzi 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This citrusy wine is all grapefruit, lime and citrus peel, with green notes poking through. Enjoyable, easy and varietally characteristic of Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Balduzzi 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Floral aromas are light and more suggestive of Pinot Noir than Syrah, with a hint of latex and mulch thrown in. A flat, sticky mouthfeel and a combination of sweet and green flavors finish with rubbery notes of latex and bitterness.
title: Tricky Rabbit 2012 Reserva Pinot Noir-Syrah (Maule Valley)

description: Floral aromas are light and more suggestive of Pinot Noir than Syrah, with a hint of latex and mulch thrown in. A flat, sticky mouthfeel and a combination of sweet and green flavors finish with rubbery notes of latex and bitterness.
title: Tricky Rabbit 2012 Reserva Pinot Noir-Syrah (Maule Valley)

description: Bland peach and melon aromas come in front of a flabby, creamy palate. Basic melon and papaya flavors are limited, with a slight bitterness lingering on a soft, fleshy finish.
title: Santa Alba 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Blackberry and cassis aromas lead to crushed tomato tones. The palate is lazy and without structure, while leafy flavors of wild berry and tomato leaf finish short, herbal and green.
title: Grÿphus 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: The aromas of black fruit, black olive and herb are solid. Racy and tangy due to pushy acidity, this has berry, herb and vanilla flavors. Fresh in feel but basic in flavor.
title: Botalcura 2009 La Porfia Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Candied melon and peach aromas lead to a creamy, woody palate that's somewhat flat in feel and short on acidity. Flavors include vanilla, cream, spicy oak and soft apple fruit. It's spicy and barrel driven on the finish.
title: Viña Requingua 2011 Puerto Viejo Reserve Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Floral and fruity on the nose, this turns wiry and racy in the mouth. It doesn't have a lot of body or weight, offering angular, lean berry and plum flavors, with a tight, peppery, acidic finish.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2010 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: Bashful, mild aromas of herbal berry fruits and mint are followed by a full, round and solid feeling palate. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and blueberry register as fairly ripe and dark, while the finish displays toasty notes, spice flavors and mild heat. This is a step up from good and basic.
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2010 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: Light, classic aromas of gooseberry, lime and nettle are good indicators of what's to follow. That would be a high-acid, racy, seemingly early picked wine with flavors of lemon, Granny Smith apple and gooseberry. A lasting, tangy, acidic finish is crackling as a lightning bolt.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Marques de Casa Concha Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: This cool-vintage Cabernet is a bit grassy and herbal on the nose, with standard berry aromas lurking in the backdrop. A tight, raw, driving palate feels focused but a touch raw, while herbal, dried flavors of plum and raspberry end with peppery spice, minty flavors and hard residual acidity.
title: Caliterra 2010 Tributo Single Vineyard Block # Quillay Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Classic, pungent feline aromas of passion fruit, citrus and grass set up a friendly palate with moderate acidity and nice flavors of nectarine, lime and green melon. The finish introduces sweet notes of banana to go with lime.
title: Santa Ema 2012 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: This wine shows ripeness, depth and purity. In the mouth, it is saturated and thick. Flavors of saffron, tomato paste, oregano and stewed berry fruits are pure Kankana. A different breed of Syrah, it reflects San Pedro's pioneering efforts in the Elqui Valley.
title: San Pedro 2010 Kankana del Elqui Solar No. 10 Syrah (Elqui Valley)

description: Rubbery plum, tomato and spice aromas are modest. This has a standard but healthy mouthfeel and flavors of raspberry, herbs and spice. On the finish, this doesn't offer anything different than what's on the palate.
title: Undurraga 2014 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Maipo Valley)

description: Rubbery plum, tomato and spice aromas are modest. This has a standard but healthy mouthfeel and flavors of raspberry, herbs and spice. On the finish, this doesn't offer anything different than what's on the palate.
title: Undurraga 2014 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Maipo Valley)

description: Berry aromas are jammy and sweet smelling. This feels chunky and bit out of shape. Herbal boysenberry flavors come with a green core, while mint, spice, heat and herbal flavors carry the finish.
title: Oveja Negra 2014 Reserva Malbec-Petit Verdot Red (Maule Valley)

description: Berry aromas are jammy and sweet smelling. This feels chunky and bit out of shape. Herbal boysenberry flavors come with a green core, while mint, spice, heat and herbal flavors carry the finish.
title: Oveja Negra 2014 Reserva Malbec-Petit Verdot Red (Maule Valley)

description: Spunky, piquant red-berry aromas contain elements of horsehide and grass. This feels mostly full and juicy, with good structure. Herbal, oaky plum and berry flavors end with a touch of oak spice and a lingering herbal, green component.
title: Concha y Toro 2014 Reserva Casillero del Diablo Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Initially this Malbec-Cabernet rosé smells of pyrazines and nettle, similar to Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth, it's citrusy and cutting, but with decent body. Flavors of grapefruit and orange pith finish slightly bitter.
title: Calcu 2015 Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of candied berry fruits, milk chocolate and peanut lack focus and purity. This feels grabby and sticky, with resiny oak. Somewhat artificial oak flavors taste creamy and clove-like, while this ends mild and chunky.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Pointy cherry, tomato and horsey aromas announce a fresh, raw palate. Bright, peppery red plum and citrus flavors finish lean, dry and grating.
title: Santa Carolina 2015 Reserva Estate Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Overripe aromas of raisin and prune are matched on a dense raisiny palate that tastes like baked black fruits. The entirety of this wine is raisiny but not unfriendly or difficult.
title: Viña Maipo 2012 Vitral Red (Chile)

description: Prickly foxy aromas are mildly pyrazinic. While this Pedro Ximénez feels plump and mostly healthy, it's short and simple in terms of flavors, with a note of briny citrus prior to a low-intensity finish.
title: Cucao 2014 Reserva Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)

description: Wiry cherry and berry aromas include a note of olive. This value Cab is lean and light in body, with leafy red-fruit flavors. An inoffensive finish with no new flavors struggles but holds it together.
title: Balduzzi 2015 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: Gritty rubbery aromas are slightly acrid, like asphalt. This is standard in feel, with generic berry flavors. Herbal spice and mild heat control the finish. Beyond that, there's not much to say about this simple Cab.
title: San Pedro 2015 Castillo de Molina Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Lightly vegetal aromas suggest asparagus. This feels round and chunky but not lazy or flabby. Flavors of citrus and citrus peel include bitter notes, while this tastes outright pithy on the finish. Drink now.
title: Viña Marty 2014 Ilaia Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Gritty citrus aromas are oily but adequate. This basic SB tastes of citrus and green vegetables. Beyond that, it's mostly fresh in feel.
title: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Gritty marginally ripe plum aromas smell a bit like a wild field. This feels full but pushy, with roughness to the palate. Herbal plum and blackberry flavors finish minty and slightly green.
title: Santa Helena 2014 Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Aromas of oily petrol and stone fruits lead to a round palate. This offers mild papaya and melony flavors in front of a leesy-tasting finish that's solid in feel.
title: Falernia 2015 Reserva Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)

description: Oily aromas of petrol are almost akin to certain Rieslings. This Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc mix feels round and mildly citrusy. Bready wheaty flavors of melon and papaya suggest that it's losing sizzle, so drink now.
title: Junta 2014 Reserve Momentos Viogner Sauvignon Blanc White (Central Valley)

description: Oily aromas of petrol are almost akin to certain Rieslings. This Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc mix feels round and mildly citrusy. Bready wheaty flavors of melon and papaya suggest that it's losing sizzle, so drink now.
title: Junta 2014 Reserve Momentos Viogner Sauvignon Blanc White (Central Valley)

description: Basic apple, melon and bready aromas are fine but not distinct or complex. Ditto the palate, which feels balanced but highly basic. Simple papaya and melon flavors finish flat.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Basic apple, melon and bready aromas are fine but not distinct or complex. Ditto the palate, which feels balanced but highly basic. Simple papaya and melon flavors finish flat.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Cherry, chocolate and toast aromas are bright and mildly oaky. This is snappy on the palate, with good energy. Raspberry and briny plum flavors are a touch spicy and finish racy and juicy.
title: San Pedro 2015 1865 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elqui Valley)

description: Aggressive cherry, plum and cassis aromas come with a hint of rubber. This feels choppy and hard, but lively. Herbal red-plum and currant flavors finish zesty and jagged, but with enough body to handle some inherent roughness.
title: Château Los Boldos 2014 Cuvée Tradition Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Aggressive cherry, plum and cassis aromas come with a hint of rubber. This feels choppy and hard, but lively. Herbal red-plum and currant flavors finish zesty and jagged, but with enough body to handle some inherent roughness.
title: Château Los Boldos 2014 Cuvée Tradition Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Punchy citrus aromas are natural like they should be for an unoaked wine. Angular and a bit sharp on the palate, this spunky style of Chardonnay deals tart peach and nectarine flavors in front of a fresh finish that's a touch sour.
title: Apaltagua 2015 Reserva Unoaked Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Modest red-fruit aromas are edgy, spicy and a touch horsey. Lean and juicy in the mouth, this new Pinot Noir from Santa Ema tastes of plum and herbal raspberry. Dry, spicy and peppery tasting on the finish; true to the variety.
title: Aila 2014 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Textbook Maipo aromas of herbal berry fruit, olive, tobacco and earth carry the nose. Feels good and tastes sweet and ripe, with herbal-leaning flavors of cassis and blackberry. Finishes smooth, with carob and more herbal character.
title: Quintay 2010 Clava Coastal Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Saline on the nose, with banana, pastry and dusty baked-apple aromas. Shows proper body, good acids and waxy flavors of citrus and apple that are influenced by barrel spice.
title: Veramonte 2010 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Bell pepper, green bean and asparagus aromas come with a touch of melon but nothing more fruity than that. A citrusy, round palate houses bitter, stretched flavors of green fruits and sulfur. Green herbs and citrus peel are the finishing notes on this grassy, green SB.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2012 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Bell pepper, green bean and asparagus aromas come with a touch of melon but nothing more fruity than that. A citrusy, round palate houses bitter, stretched flavors of green fruits and sulfur. Green herbs and citrus peel are the finishing notes on this grassy, green SB.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2012 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Generic white-fruit aromas come with a modicum of zest. The palate is simple in feel but holds steady, while flavors of citrus and pith finish sweet, with distant notes of orange and passion fruit.
title: Beach Kite 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Aromas of bath soap, air freshener and vegetal fruits lead to a tangy, linear palate with green flavors mixed with citrus and melon. This basic Chard holds onto those green-ish characteristics on the finish.
title: Lazo 2012 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Apple and peach aromas struggle to reach the rudimentary level. There's a slight vegetal note to the flavor profile along with sugary melon and pear. This feels flat but not tired, and things taste mildly green and candied on the finish.
title: Santa Luz 2012 Gran Reserva Corte Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Apple and peach aromas struggle to reach the rudimentary level. There's a slight vegetal note to the flavor profile along with sugary melon and pear. This feels flat but not tired, and things taste mildly green and candied on the finish.
title: Santa Luz 2012 Gran Reserva Corte Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Pérez Cruz makes some nice wines, but this blend of Petit Verdot, Carmenère and Malbec is so full of herbaceous aromas and flavors of juniper, olive and coffee grinds that it's a struggle to get through. Yes, the mouthfeel and structure are that of a serious wine. But the aromas and flavors are so green and mean that it's impossible to rate this blend higher.
title: Viña Pérez Cruz 2009 Quelen Special Selection Red (Maipo Valley)

description: A blast of rubber is the aromatic greeting, followed by herbal notes and leather. A sharp, tight, acidic palate proves difficult to penetrate, while crisp, herbal red-plum flavors finish green.
title: Emiliana 2011 Natura Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: Baked, raisiny aromas indicate a very ripe wine. This feels full and heavy on the tongue, with dark, toasty flavors that turn bitter, oaky and peppery on the finish.
title: San Nicolas 2011 Maigo Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: A dark and easy style of Syrah with a pitch-black tint and sweet, ripe aromas of pastry, pencil lead, chocolate and blackberry. Feels grippy and mildly tannic, with prune, blackberry and a note of mint on the flavor profile. Finishes minty, chocolaty and friendly.
title: San Pedro 2009 Castillo de Molina Reserva Shiraz (Maule Valley)

description: Dusty blackberry and dark plum aromas come with spice, particulary pepper. Feels crisp, juicy and tight on the palate, with plum, cherry, red licorice candy and peppery flavors. Dry on the finish, and only slightly herbal overall.
title: Emiliana 2010 Natura Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of rubber and herbs meet black cherry on the nose. The palate is lively, with bold acidity and grabby tannins carrying flavors of black plum, cassis and loamy earth. Drink this functional, everyday red through 2017.
title: Lapostolle 2013 Casa Grand Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of rubber and herbs meet black cherry on the nose. The palate is lively, with bold acidity and grabby tannins carrying flavors of black plum, cassis and loamy earth. Drink this functional, everyday red through 2017.
title: Lapostolle 2013 Casa Grand Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Snappy berry and plum aromas are good but lack complexity. This is a standard, well-made blend of 60% Cabernet and 40% Merlot. It's medium in body, with firm tannins and flavors of hard spices, pepper, cherry and plum. A toasty, peppery finish is lean and direct.
title: Quasar 2013 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Snappy berry and plum aromas are good but lack complexity. This is a standard, well-made blend of 60% Cabernet and 40% Merlot. It's medium in body, with firm tannins and flavors of hard spices, pepper, cherry and plum. A toasty, peppery finish is lean and direct.
title: Quasar 2013 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Cherry and plum aromas are generic. This feels fresh, with a tight grip and resiny oak. Cherry flavors come with grainy, slightly bitter oak notes, while this finishes dry, woody and raw in feel.
title: Santa Luz 2015 Reserva Encinos Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Gritty aromas of black olive and road tar rest heavily atop herbal berry scents. This mystery blend is tight and tannic as nails. Blackened flavors of gritty blackberry, clove and wood spice finish rough and scratchy.
title: Montemar 2013 Gran Reserva Assemblage Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Gritty aromas of black olive and road tar rest heavily atop herbal berry scents. This mystery blend is tight and tannic as nails. Blackened flavors of gritty blackberry, clove and wood spice finish rough and scratchy.
title: Montemar 2013 Gran Reserva Assemblage Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: This Elqui SB smells about as neutral as you'll come across, with a hint of burnt grass to the nose. Oily and dense in feel, this tastes of salt and bitter dried melon.
title: Mayu 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Dusty apple aromas are nice for this level of wine. A round, solid mouthfeel is a plus, while flavors of melon, apple and nectarine come with light oak and vanilla offsets. A pithy, melony finish concludes this easygoing Chardonnay.
title: Château Los Boldos 2013 Cuvée Tradition Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: With savory aromas of soy sauce and beef broth, this is not only fruity smelling, it's meaty on the nose. The palate is full and voluminous, but not thick. Flavors of boysenberry and blackberry are slightly leafy and green, while the finish shows a good texture and grabby tannins.
title: Concha y Toro 2011 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Malbec (Rapel Valley)

description: There's a lot of fruit to this New World Syrah. Cherry, cassis and berry aromas are fresh and forward, while in the mouth, this is full but not overly demanding or exact. Flavors of cherry and plum come with creamy oak notes of vanilla, while the finish is crisp in feel but generic in flavor.
title: Santa Rita 2009 Reserva Syrah (Maipo Valley)

description: Plum, cherry and strawberry aromas are light, true and minerally. This is a juicy, fresh, medium-weight wine with plum and raspberry. Nothing about this is pushy; overall, it's a bright, lifted quaffer that's totally satisfying.
title: Quintay 2012 Coastal Reserve Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Resiny oak, cinnamon and white-fruit aromas are solid. This is juicy and minerally in the mouth, with plenty of barrel weight for cushion. Flavors of apple, citrus and oak finish minerally but with some dilution of flavor. Drink during 2014.
title: Merino 2012 Limestone Hill Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Chunky cherry, cough drop and dusty aromas make for a ripe but alluring nose. This feels big and full, as will most 2012 Chilean Pinot Noirs; flavors of baked black fruits and raspberry are about as rich and sweet as Pinot should ever get, while a smooth, chocolaty finish is modest in terms of acidity.
title: Leyda 2012 Single Vineyard Las Brisas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Aromas are drawn and mildly green in nature. In the mouth, this is soft and stewy, with as much green herb and mint as berry fruit and richness. On the finish, this feels syrupy but tastes a bit like salad, with candied sweetness thrown in.
title: Ventisquero 2010 Grey [Glacier] Single Block Trinidad Vineyard Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Coffee, mint and earthy blackberry aromas open this rich, ripe—almost unctuous—Carmenère. Spiced berry and lightly herbal black plum flavors finish full and balanced, while ending flavors of dark-roast coffee, chocolate and herbs are just right.
title: Arboleda 2012 Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Snappy aromas of briny citrus fruits, jalapeño and bell pepper leave no doubt that this is Leyda Sauv Blanc. The palate is minerally and crisp, with juicy acidity. Flavors of lime, pickle brine, gooseberry and wet stone finish elegant and pure, with cleansing acidity.
title: San Pedro 2014 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Big-time woody aromas are charred to the max, something that's normal for TerraNoble. A tannic palate is firm and staunch. Woody blackberry flavors include a sweet dose of molasses, while coffee, spiced berry and lemony oak flavors are the conclusion on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot.
title: TerraNoble 2013 Lahuen Azul Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (San Clemente)

description: Ripe berry aromas are heady. In the mouth, this hard-edged Cabernet is gritty and smacking. Ripe plum and blackberry flavors are backed by hefty but pulling tannins, and overall the texture is quite rough.
title: Awning 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Apalta)

description: Earthy, lightly grilled plum and berry aromas are a bit damp. Like a gate slamming shut, this is abrupt on a clipped palate. Choppy red-plum, tomato and herbal flavors lead to a gravelly and crisp finish, with astringent tannins.
title: Alta Cima 2013 Special Edition Ensamblaje Gran Reserva Red (Lontué Valley)

description: Immediately this Syrah-led blend registers as something special. Ripe berry and herb aromas are spicy, fresh and textbook for Chile. A full, dense, chewy palate is potent but under control. Flavors of olive, spice, coffee, toast and dark fruits finish with barrel spice, a final wave of black-fruit flavor and notes of juniper and eucalyptus. Drink through 2021.
title: Loma Larga 2012 Unfiltered Rapsodia Red (Casablanca Valley)

description: High-toned and citric on the nose, with foresty spice and a whiff of the ocean. Tight and nervy in the mouth, with herbal, spicy red plum flavors that are true to the variety. Honest but a touch lean and fiery on the finish.
title: Leyda 2010 Classic Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: A slight amount of eucalyptus on the nose gives this wine an herbal element to go with cassis and blackberry. The palate is tightly wound and brawny, with cassis, olive and herbal flavors. Meaty and savory late, with depth, texture and vitality.
title: Emiliana 2009 Novas Limited Selection Carmenère-Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Lavender, thyme, rosemary and other green herb notes dot the nose, which leads to a solid, cushioned palate with sweet berry, leaf, spice and carob flavors. Finishes sweet, with melted chocolate and heft. Just short of excellent but still the best Carmenère yet from François Lurton's Colchagua property.
title: François Lurton 2007 Hacienda Araucano Alka Carmenère (Lolol Valley)

description: Lavender, thyme, rosemary and other green herb notes dot the nose, which leads to a solid, cushioned palate with sweet berry, leaf, spice and carob flavors. Finishes sweet, with melted chocolate and heft. Just short of excellent but still the best Carmenère yet from François Lurton's Colchagua property.
title: François Lurton 2007 Hacienda Araucano Alka Carmenère (Lolol Valley)

description: Green and focused on the nose, with a hint of fresh bell pepper. The palate is light and chiseled, with crisp flavors of white grapefruit, lime and passion fruit. Finishes elegant and fresh. An ideal quaffer to go with salads and shellfish.
title: Los Molles 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

description: Hailing from chilly Casablanca, this Syrah shows a soupy, vegetal smelling nose that's mildly green and earthy. The palate feels pretty good and chunky, but the flavor profile runs green, with an herbal finish.
title: Loma Larga 2008 Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Sort of creamy and unconvincing on the nose, with carob and stemmy berry aromas. The palate runs toward red fruit, but it's also a bit green and herbal. Finishing notes of chocolate and green herbs are typical of Merlot, yet there isn't enough ripe fruit or excitement. Hence, it's a mid-level red wine with some green character. Contains 9% Cabernet and 5% Shiraz.
title: Caliterra 2007 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Shows some roughness and burnt leaves on the nose, but it settles on raspberry and cherry. In the mouth, it's a bit soft and flat due to low acidity, and the flavors lean toward sweet and candied, as if some residual sugar was left on the wine. Tastes good enough, but it's candied and simple. Drink now.
title: Viña Requingua 2008 Puerto Viejo PV Rosé (Curicó Valley)

description: Earthy, ripe and a touch mulchy smelling at first, this blend comes around to show full plum and berry scents. The palate is bulky—a reflection of a warm vintage. Ripe berry notes house chocolate and fig flavors, with a touch salt finishing it off. Drink through 2019.
title: Antiyal 2012 Red (Maipo Valley)

description: On the nose, this blend is leathery and earthy. Bold berry and cassis flavors on the palate are amplified by strong notes of baking spice and chocolate, while the finish is oaky and shows moderate complexity. Drink through 2019.
title: Viña San Vicente 2012 Coordenada Lircay Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: On the nose, this blend is leathery and earthy. Bold berry and cassis flavors on the palate are amplified by strong notes of baking spice and chocolate, while the finish is oaky and shows moderate complexity. Drink through 2019.
title: Viña San Vicente 2012 Coordenada Lircay Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: In this racy, full-bodied wine, olive, spice, chocolate and berry aromas come in front of a flush but acidic palate with a tartaric influence. Herbal red-berry and olive flavors finish long and lasting, with a tomato note.
title: Undurraga 2010 Founder's Collection Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: With integrated aromas of balsam wood, cassis, cherry and mixed spices, this smells elegant and inviting. A concentrated palate is slightly narrow in feel, while flavors of baked plum, cassis, black cherry and hard spices finish with toasty oak and chocolate notes. Drink through 2017.
title: Viu Manent 2010 La Capilla Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Cedar, graphite, plum and berry aromas make for a good bouquet. This feels fresh, albeit choppy, while flavors of cassis, berry fruits, oak and herbs come together well. A quick finish lacks complexity, so drink this blend of Carmenère, Petit Verdot and Shiraz now.
title: Santa Alicia 2012 Anke Winemaker's Blend Selection Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Cedar, graphite, plum and berry aromas make for a good bouquet. This feels fresh, albeit choppy, while flavors of cassis, berry fruits, oak and herbs come together well. A quick finish lacks complexity, so drink this blend of Carmenère, Petit Verdot and Shiraz now.
title: Santa Alicia 2012 Anke Winemaker's Blend Selection Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of briary blackberry, licorice and baking spices set up a full, chunky mouthfeel. Big black-fruit flavors are slightly minty and herbal, while the finish is earthy and minty, with bright acidity maintaining freshness.
title: Montes 2012 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a riper, heavier than usual Don Melchor, as evidenced by aromas of raisin along with black plum, coffee and creamy oak. A full, round, plush palate offers more than adequate depth, while black cherry, plum and vanilla flavors come with hints of licorice and chocolate. Hailing from a hot vintage, this avoids almost all herbal characteristics but feels a bit soft and simple. Drink through 2023.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Don Melchor Puente Alto Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Puente Alto)

description: Toasty and solid on the nose, with hints of mineral, dark spice, black olive and cassis. It's structured but a little rich and sticky, with sweet berry and cassis flavors along with brown sugar on the finish. A blend of six grapes that's easygoing and generous. Drink now through 2013.
title: Pargua 2007 Anka Pargua II Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Toasty and solid on the nose, with hints of mineral, dark spice, black olive and cassis. It's structured but a little rich and sticky, with sweet berry and cassis flavors along with brown sugar on the finish. A blend of six grapes that's easygoing and generous. Drink now through 2013.
title: Pargua 2007 Anka Pargua II Red (Maipo Valley)

description: One sniff receives immediate prickle and a hint of fresh bell pepper offset by citrus blossom and passion fruit. All the components of excellent Sauvignon Blanc appear in this carved, sizzling wine: tangerine, orange, grapefruit and lime flavors; freshness and physique; purity and sense of place.
title: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: One sniff receives immediate prickle and a hint of fresh bell pepper offset by citrus blossom and passion fruit. All the components of excellent Sauvignon Blanc appear in this carved, sizzling wine: tangerine, orange, grapefruit and lime flavors; freshness and physique; purity and sense of place.
title: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Aromas of bell pepper and canned peas are offset by lime and grapefruit notes. This feels citrusy but diluted, while pyrazine-driven flavors of bell pepper and lettuce finish fresh but watery.
title: Santa Rita 2014 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Aromas of bell pepper and canned peas are offset by lime and grapefruit notes. This feels citrusy but diluted, while pyrazine-driven flavors of bell pepper and lettuce finish fresh but watery.
title: Santa Rita 2014 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: This six-grape blend is led by Cabernet Sauvignon. Aromas of toasty, rooty berry fruits come with an essence of cola. The palate is layered and mellow, offering mild tannins. An oaky flavor profile includes coconut and vanilla, while the finish is spicy, mildly herbal and a touch chocolaty.
title: Chilensis 2011 Lazuli Red (Maule Valley)

description: Initial woody aromas evolve in the glass to show perfume, raisiny ripeness and spice notes. In the mouth, this delivers a crunchy, tannic feel and vibrant acidity. Plum, raspberry, baking spice and earthy flavors end with oaky vanilla notes offset by baked berry, cassis and rooty flavors. Drink through 2020.
title: Garage Wine Co. 2011 Lot #36 Maipo Alto Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

description: With mineral and apple on the nose, this qualifies as a pure and pleasing SB for almost any occasion. The palate is elegant and lithe, while the flavors of green apple, gooseberry and grapefruit are what they should be. Pure, sound and solid wine to drink right now.
title: Casa Silva 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: With mineral and apple on the nose, this qualifies as a pure and pleasing SB for almost any occasion. The palate is elegant and lithe, while the flavors of green apple, gooseberry and grapefruit are what they should be. Pure, sound and solid wine to drink right now.
title: Casa Silva 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Lemon, apple and other standard aromas give it a familiar if unspectacular opening. The palate is full, mildly creamy and offers decent acidity in support of peach and nectarine flavors. Solid as a whole for $12 Chilean Chardonnay.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Estate Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Lemon, apple and other standard aromas give it a familiar if unspectacular opening. The palate is full, mildly creamy and offers decent acidity in support of peach and nectarine flavors. Solid as a whole for $12 Chilean Chardonnay.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Estate Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Forceful, meaty and a little herbal on the nose, but still pretty solid for $9 Merlot. The palate is full and sizable, with plum, berry and herbal flavors creating Chilean typicity. Falls off on the finish, turning more herbal, but overall it's a good value wine.
title: Viu Manent 2010 Estate Collection Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: A super pungent style of SB that will knock you over with nettle, grapefruit, passion fruit and sweaty aromas. The palate is sheer and citric, with tight, angular flavors of lemon, lime, pineapple and green herbs. Zesty to the point of scouring, with jalapeño heat on the finish.
title: Viu Manent 2010 Secreto Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Soft aromas of sea shell, stone and mango appear in the bouquet. In the mouth, this is big and clumsy, with cidery flavors that continue onto the finish. Like many 2012 Chilean Chardonnays, this is overly ripe and not in the best balance.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2012 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: This Chardonnay opens with a strong blast of oak resin that frankly doesn't smell very natural or nice. The palate feel is heavy and mealy, while flavors of resiny oak and salt lack fruit. The finish is much the same: salty and oaky.
title: Vistamar 2011 Sepia Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This Chardonnay opens with a strong blast of oak resin that frankly doesn't smell very natural or nice. The palate feel is heavy and mealy, while flavors of resiny oak and salt lack fruit. The finish is much the same: salty and oaky.
title: Vistamar 2011 Sepia Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Light vanilla and chunky tropical fruit aromas open this basic Chardonnay. The palate is weighty, while flavors of pineapple, mango and oak run sweet. On the finish, it falls off and doesn't hold up.
title: Arauco 2012 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: This mild Sauvignon Blanc offers simple citrus and passion fruit aromas in front of an oily-feeling, pulpy palate. Flavors of vinaigrette, cactus and grapefruit finish with mealy lemon and orange notes.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Animal Cracker, Creamsicle and chemical aromas combine to create a difficult bouquet. This is a hollow wine with bland flavors of rubber band and apple. A strained, oddly oaky tasting finish does little to help.
title: Soleca 2012 3 Generaciones Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Aromas of orange blossom and pineapple juice are not substantial. In the mouth, this is chunky and plump, with oily peach and nectarine flavors mixed with some green bean. A heavy finish with little spine provides minimal cut and freshness.
title: Vistamar 2012 Brisa Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Aromas of tire rubber, eucalyptus and scratchy black fruits set up a shear, acidic palate with flavors of salty, herbal, somewhat sour berry and plum. A rough, scouring finish is par for the course.
title: Morandé 2010 Reserva Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

description: Aromas of tire rubber, eucalyptus and scratchy black fruits set up a shear, acidic palate with flavors of salty, herbal, somewhat sour berry and plum. A rough, scouring finish is par for the course.
title: Morandé 2010 Reserva Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

description: Mild aromas of apple cider bring no real aromatic gravitas. The feel is good but basic, with fresh acidity and wetness. Flavors of nectarine, peach pit and citrus finish dry, pithy and short.
title: Echeverria 2012 Reserva Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: This is light and fresh, with melony aromas. It's plump and waning on the palate, with a splash of citric acidity. Mealy nectarine flavors lead to a stalky finish that loses steam.
title: Leyendas de Familia 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This is light and fresh, with melony aromas. It's plump and waning on the palate, with a splash of citric acidity. Mealy nectarine flavors lead to a stalky finish that loses steam.
title: Leyendas de Familia 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: No matter how you cut it, this blend of Petit Verdot, Malbec and Carmenère is herbaceous and loaded with green notes and punches of eucalyptus. In the mouth, it's raw and grating, while flavors of eucalyptus and herbal black fruits lead to a hard, tannic finish.
title: Viña Pérez Cruz 2007 Quelen Special Selection Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Air freshener and tropical aromas lead to a juice-like palate with green tannins. Lime, nettle and nopal flavors finish heavy.
title: Vaya Vadiso 2012 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: A gold color and flat nose are indicators that this doesn't have a lot of life to it. Creamy, baked, sweet aromas lead to a round, mellow palate with applesauce and creamy, lactic flavors. A sugary finish is low on acidic cut and is slightly cloying.
title: San Pedro 2012 Epica Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Overt oak, tobacco and earthy cherry and plum aromas create a nice bouquet on this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend. A loamy, plump palate is just firm enough, while herbal plum and cassis flavors finish with carob, coffee and vanilla notes. Drink through 2017.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2011 Doña Bernarda Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: A bit hot and crusty on the nose, with black fruit and herbal notes of olive and bramble. The palate is full but hard as nails, with a tannic bite that is wicked like a shark. Flavors are full and drying due to the tannins, with herbal accents. Finishing flavors of coffee and spice cement its dark, muscular status.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2008 Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: A bit hot and crusty on the nose, with black fruit and herbal notes of olive and bramble. The palate is full but hard as nails, with a tannic bite that is wicked like a shark. Flavors are full and drying due to the tannins, with herbal accents. Finishing flavors of coffee and spice cement its dark, muscular status.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2008 Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Aromas of graphite, rich berry fruit and leather dominate the nose. This Syrah has a jammy, yet layered mouthfeel, along with flavors of berry, toast, graphite and mint. Overall this is a deep, full-bodied wine that's quite toasty and oaky.
title: Casas del Bosque 2012 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Aromas of graphite, rich berry fruit and leather dominate the nose. This Syrah has a jammy, yet layered mouthfeel, along with flavors of berry, toast, graphite and mint. Overall this is a deep, full-bodied wine that's quite toasty and oaky.
title: Casas del Bosque 2012 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Subtle aromas of marzipan and cola yield to overriding prune and raisin scents on this extremely ripe, almost overripe blend. Soft and spongy on the palate, with berry and prune flavors, this shows smoke and toast notes on a low-pulse finish. Drink now.
title: Primus 2012 The Blend Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Subtle aromas of marzipan and cola yield to overriding prune and raisin scents on this extremely ripe, almost overripe blend. Soft and spongy on the palate, with berry and prune flavors, this shows smoke and toast notes on a low-pulse finish. Drink now.
title: Primus 2012 The Blend Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of green apple and citrus are as classic as it gets for Chilean Sauv Blanc. This is straight forward but enjoyable, with modest minerality. Flavors of citrus and gooseberry carry over onto a refreshing finish.
title: Ritual 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Nutty, honeyed apple and melon aromas come with plenty of raw wood grain. This is an oaky, resiny Chardonnay with just enough core acidity to maintain balance. Creamy apple and melon flavors finish on barrel-driven resin and cinnamon accents.
title: Montes 2014 Alpha Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Herbal, briary berry aromas are minty and suggestive of olive. The mouthfeel is plump and juicy, while herbal blackberry and black currant flavors finish with a blast of toast and mint. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Syrah is quintessentially Chilean in aromas, flavors and intensity. Drink through 2020.
title: Siegel 2011 Gran Crucero Limited Edition Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: A harmonious mix of dry spice, herbal berry and rubbery aromas sets up a full-bodied palate that's brimming with ample oak and firm tannins. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Carmenère is rugged but generous, with loads of raspberry, plum and herbal flavors resting before an earthy finish of acidic vitality, tomato notes and herbal impressions. Drink through 2018.
title: Santa Alicia 2010 Millantu Red (Maipo Valley)

description: This Torontel is elegant and stately, delivering apricot, peach, mango and spice aromas on the bouquet. A fruity, full-bodied palate is sticky but braced by proper acidity, while cinnamon, caramel, toffee and baked pear flavors finish long and yummy.
title: Caliboro Estate 2009 Erasmo Late Harvest Torontel (Maule Valley)

description: Dry, spicy and showing aromas of cherry and herbs that are true to the grape. Medium bodied, with light cherry, raspberry and peppery flavors, and the finish is toasty and oaky, with cocoa. A touch herbal and strained but for the most part it's true, likable Pinot Noir.
title: Morandé 2008 Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dry, spicy and showing aromas of cherry and herbs that are true to the grape. Medium bodied, with light cherry, raspberry and peppery flavors, and the finish is toasty and oaky, with cocoa. A touch herbal and strained but for the most part it's true, likable Pinot Noir.
title: Morandé 2008 Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Nice melon, apple, talcum powder and mineral aromas set this off in a good direction. The palate is lively and balanced, with grapefruit as the prime flavor. Calm on the finish; a good quaffer if you get at it as fast as possible.
title: Echeverria 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: White-fruit aromas suggest peach and melon, but there's also some sourness and green thrown in. Acidic but fresh in the mouth, with citrusy flavors of lime and grapefruit. Acutely citric on the finish, with a hint of asparagus.
title: Chilcas 2008 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Among Garage Wine's 2014 single-vineyard Carignans and blends, this might be the best one. Bagual is a Carignan-Garnacha-Mataro blend that's earthy and full of black-fruit aromas and foresty notes. A staunch tight palate shows some elasticity, while this tastes of earthy berry fruits and cola. A dense but not overly aggressive finish seals this away. Drink through 2025.
designation: Lot #56 Bagual Vineyard Carignan-Garnacha-Mataró Field-Blend Caliboro
title: Garage Wine Co. 2014 Lot #56 Bagual Vineyard Carignan-Garnacha-Mataró Field-Blend Caliboro Red (Maule Valley)

description: Plum and wild berry aromas are slightly briny and volatile. Pinched acidity and related sharpness result in a rough mouthfeel, while plum, raspberry and currant flavors feel wiry, with an earthy, lightly oaked finish.
title: Root:1 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Opens with crusty, rock-solid aromas of mineral, shoe polish, herb and dense black fruit. This is a thick but smooth-bodied Cabernet with richness and sweet flavors of blackberry, cassis, fine herbes and brown sugar. Mild tannins, excellent structure and length define the finish. Drink now through 2016.
title: Concha y Toro 2008 Don Melchor Cabernet Sauvignon (Puente Alto)

description: Oceanic and crisp smelling, with green apple, citrus and light oak on the nose. Has roundness and weight, but juiciness as well. Tastes a touch sweet and syrupy, with tropical fruit flavors. Chunky and a little sticky on the finish despite boasting a solid acid level.
title: Arboleda 2010 Chardonnay (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Concentrated on the nose, with wild berry and cassis aromas. Feels fresh and grippy due to firm tannins, with snappy red berry, plum and mild oak flavors. Not all that complex and showing little more than bright, pleasant fruit flavors and firmness.
title: Chilensis 2010 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Concentrated on the nose, with wild berry and cassis aromas. Feels fresh and grippy due to firm tannins, with snappy red berry, plum and mild oak flavors. Not all that complex and showing little more than bright, pleasant fruit flavors and firmness.
title: Chilensis 2010 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Big, herbal and rich on the nose, with minerality and a lot of olive and black-fruit aromas. The palate is round, full-bodied and chewy, with ample oak, herbal flavors and blackberry. Tasty, robust and not short on oak and herbal notes. In a word, it's Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Errazuriz 2009 Single Vineyard Don Maximiano Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: A serious, fairly rich wine with grippy tannins and typical Maipo aromas of herbs, tobacco and olive that meet at eucalyptus. Hails from low-production old vines in Macul and Buin; the wine is round and full in the mouth, with lightly roasted berry flavors and touches of sweet caramel and chocolate on the finish.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2008 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)

description: A serious, fairly rich wine with grippy tannins and typical Maipo aromas of herbs, tobacco and olive that meet at eucalyptus. Hails from low-production old vines in Macul and Buin; the wine is round and full in the mouth, with lightly roasted berry flavors and touches of sweet caramel and chocolate on the finish.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2008 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Rooty licorice, leather and olive aromas are solid, with pleasing berry scents. This feels plump, with a touch of tartaric acid popping up. Peppery plum and olive flavors are textbook for the variety, while the finish is forward and robust.
title: Undurraga 2013 Sibaris Reserva Especial Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Woodsy, spicy aromas of herbal plum and berry come with a light coating of chocolate. A round, rubbery palate is tight in the long run. Saturated plum and blackberry flavors are oaky in front of an extracted finish that runs long and doesn't hold back. Drink through 2022.
title: François Lurton 2013 Hacienda Araucano Clos de Lolol Red (Lolol Valley)

description: Prickly green-herb and cactus aromas are punchy but not overly pungent. This offers a mix of softer tropical acidity and harder citric brightness, which sets the stage for flavors of grapefruit, lime and tropical fruits. A steady, lively finish is lasting.
title: Leyda 2016 Lot 4 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Quite leafy smelling, with tobacco and a ton of barrel influence. Big, woody and resiny feeling, with rugged tannins pushing sweet, ripe berry and spice flavors. Toasty, chocolaty and herbal as it finishes, but always there's a strong oak presence.
title: Errazuriz 2008 Don Maximiano Founder's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Heavily charred and roasted plum and berry aromas become greener upon full inspection. This blend of Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc along with Syrah feels tight, with chewy tannins. Herbal plum flavors are peppery and spicy, with a green note popping up prior to a somewhat hot finish.
title: Trio 2014 Reserva Premium Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Spicy plum, berry and herbal aromas cover the bases. This Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah blend is drawing and pulling on the palate. Raw, spicy flavors of toasty plum and herbs finish with a dominant note of wood spice.
title: Oveja Negra 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Colchagua Costa)

description: A mild whiff of gasoline is typical for Riesling, while this also smells a touch cheesy but not funky. A straight-ahead lemony palate delivers short blasts of lemon and underripe nectarine flavors, while the finish is mostly fresh and focused.
title: Meli 2016 Riesling (Maule Valley)

description: Aromas of black olive and road tar include mixed-berry scents. A tight, staunchly acidic palate is rather shrill, while salty, acid-driven flavors of plum and wild berry finish long but sharp.
title: Mancura 2014 Reserva Guardián Carignan (Maule Valley)

description: Aromas of roasted savory berry fruits and baked beans are solid. This Merlot exhibits good grip on a medium-bodied palate. Salty earthy flavors of berry fruits and dry oak finish leafy and spicy.
title: Viña Chocalan 2014 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Chemical aromas are barely lifted by bland berry fruit scents, and overall this smells like wet cement. Tannic but weak in the middle, this tastes herbal and green, with a raw, herbaceous finish.
title: Santa Rita 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Chemical aromas are barely lifted by bland berry fruit scents, and overall this smells like wet cement. Tannic but weak in the middle, this tastes herbal and green, with a raw, herbaceous finish.
title: Santa Rita 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: This is basically Sauvignon Blanc (with 3% Viognier and Chardonnay). And it's a narrow version, with pungent, sweaty aromas and bitter-leaning flavors that suggest early harvesting in a hot year. A green, peppery finish lacks roundness and full ripeness.
title: Estampa 2012 Reserve Assemblage Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Casablanca Valley)

description: A bright magenta color and aromas of blueberry juice and wet dog suggest a basic wine that's all about fruit and not much about style or complexity. The palate is lively and juicy, the flavors are vivacious but immature, and the finish falls off fast.
title: Sombras del Sol 2011 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Plump aromas of melon and almond candy announce a chunky palate with citric acidity. Pithy orange and melon flavors are straightforward, with some sweetness. Consider this a decent, generic white wine.
title: Morandé 2012 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Casablanca Valley)

description: Stony aromas suggest crushed vitamin and lime. This is not thin but not really full either. Crisp flavors of green apple and citrus come with notes of bell pepper, while the finish is mildly green and briny tasting.
title: Cono Sur 2016 Organic Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

description: Opens with heavy aromas of earth, compost and baked fruit. The palate has a corresponding heaviness and sweet, roasted, buttery black-fruit flavors. Sticky and oaky on the finish, with lasting sweetness and some bitterness. Chunky and clunky, but not a bad wine.
title: William Cole 2009 Columbine Special Reserve Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Forceful on the nose, with herbal, saucy, rubbery aromas. It's weighty in the mouth, with blackberry, herbal tomato and dry spice flavors. Feels pretty good on the finish, which comes with a lasting herbal accent. A little grating but solid enough.
title: Veramonte 2008 Reserva Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

description: Forceful on the nose, with herbal, saucy, rubbery aromas. It's weighty in the mouth, with blackberry, herbal tomato and dry spice flavors. Feels pretty good on the finish, which comes with a lasting herbal accent. A little grating but solid enough.
title: Veramonte 2008 Reserva Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

description: Plump, sweet and tropical on the nose, but also not that focused or powerful. The palate is flat in feel and a bit sticky, with vague, candied flavors of papaya and melon. There's even an Animal Cracker quality to the finish. Good but not great.
title: Emiliana 2008 Novas Limited Selection Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A bit narrow and medicinal, but overall this Cab delivers reasonably good cherry and herbal berry aromas and flavors along with some oak, coconut, citric acid and earth. It's a touch muddled and all over the map, but for $10 it's a pretty good wine.
title: Siegel 2008 Crucero Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: A bit narrow and medicinal, but overall this Cab delivers reasonably good cherry and herbal berry aromas and flavors along with some oak, coconut, citric acid and earth. It's a touch muddled and all over the map, but for $10 it's a pretty good wine.
title: Siegel 2008 Crucero Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: A little earthy and leafy on the nose and palate, but we like the wine's balance and saturation as well as its flavors of herbal cherry and berry. Finishes more roasted and warm, with kick carrying it toward conclusion. Grabby and leafy but good for $9.
title: Santa Alicia 2008 Reserva Shiraz (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a new wine playing at Chile's high-priced, icon level. Fresh yet oaky on the nose, with aromas of herbs and char, this is layered, pure and smooth on the palate. Spice, oak and chocolate mix with berry and plum flavors, while the dry, long, oaky finish is on the money. Drink this well-crafted Cabernet blend through 2022.
title: Vik 2011 Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Roasted, leathery berry aromas are dense, complex and include a tarry note of fresh asphalt. This Carmenère-led blend is both chewy and deep, complete with fine-grain tannins. Rooty cherry and cassis flavors are spicy, while a full-feeling finish tastes of cola, pepper, herbs and spice. Drink through 2024.
title: Antiyal 2013 Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Roasted, leathery berry aromas are dense, complex and include a tarry note of fresh asphalt. This Carmenère-led blend is both chewy and deep, complete with fine-grain tannins. Rooty cherry and cassis flavors are spicy, while a full-feeling finish tastes of cola, pepper, herbs and spice. Drink through 2024.
title: Antiyal 2013 Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Hits heavy with the olive and burnt rubber aromas, then turns ultrazesty and citric in the mouth. Tastes tangy and herbal, with tomato and sour plum flavors. A raw, tart wine.
title: Root:1 2009 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Hits heavy with the olive and burnt rubber aromas, then turns ultrazesty and citric in the mouth. Tastes tangy and herbal, with tomato and sour plum flavors. A raw, tart wine.
