description: Clean and minerally on the nose, but it's not very aromatic or exciting. The palate is fresh and tangy, with orange, lemon, green apple and mild spice flavors. The longer the wine sits, the more its acidity and raciness take over. Crisp and bone dry.
title: Viña Tabalí 2011 Reserva Especial Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Hailing from coastal Leyda, this wine has a bouquet that comes with an oceanic edge, plus grass and green fruit aromas. The palate is crisp and lively, with good acidity bolstering citrus, lychee, melon and grass flavors. The finish is cleansing.
title: Santa Carolina 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Gritty aromas of charred beef and tar lead to a tight, drawing palate with hard tannins. Balsamic flavors of roasted plum, blackberry and green herbs finish tight, grating and with residual tannic bite. If you know Chilean Carmenère, this fits the mold.
designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: More or less clean and neutral on the nose, with aromatic notes of peach and apple. The palate is juicy but sort of jumpy, with flavors of orange, pithy bitterness and roast corn. Good in this price range but seemingly on its way to being past its prime.
title: Viña Tinajas 2006 Viejo Feo Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Koyle Reserva shows the upside of Carmenère while not pushing too hard. Smoky aromas of roasted berry, graphite and olive are vociferous yet balanced. A layered, meaty palate is home to minty, resiny flavors of berry fruits, herbs and chocolate, while the finish is oaky, toasty and attractive.
title: Koyle 2011 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Koyle Reserva shows the upside of Carmenère while not pushing too hard. Smoky aromas of roasted berry, graphite and olive are vociferous yet balanced. A layered, meaty palate is home to minty, resiny flavors of berry fruits, herbs and chocolate, while the finish is oaky, toasty and attractive.
title: Koyle 2011 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Earthy, baked aromas of ripe berry, raisin and leather come with a tobacco note. This is nice given the cold weather that drove the 2011 vintage. Round tannins and overall balance provide bedding for spicy flavors of blackberry, herbal notes, licorice and oak.
title: Montes 2011 Alpha Marchigue Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Earthy, baked aromas of ripe berry, raisin and leather come with a tobacco note. This is nice given the cold weather that drove the 2011 vintage. Round tannins and overall balance provide bedding for spicy flavors of blackberry, herbal notes, licorice and oak.
title: Montes 2011 Alpha Marchigue Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This big, jammy Syrah from the Maipo Alto is typically leathery and spicy smelling. The body on this wine is fat and weighty, while flavors of buttery oak and spiced berry meld together if given time in the glass. On the finish, this is oaky and herbal tasting, with a creamy feel.
title: Viña Pérez Cruz 2010 Limited Edition Syrah (Maipo Valley)

description: Round black-fruit aromas are bold and friendly, while in the mouth this is grabby and full bodied. Flavors of roasted plum and berry are generous albeit a hint green in the middle, while toasty darkness defines the finish, which brings a touch of bitterness.
title: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Round black-fruit aromas are bold and friendly, while in the mouth this is grabby and full bodied. Flavors of roasted plum and berry are generous albeit a hint green in the middle, while toasty darkness defines the finish, which brings a touch of bitterness.
title: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Some hard scratchiness on the nose announces that this has power and isn't generic. Additional scents of leather, olive and roasted berry are typical for a Maipo Cab. In the mouth, it's on stride and fresh, while flavors of earth, vanilla and carob accent generic berry and cassis.
title: Viña Casablanca 2011 Cefiro Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Intense, compact aromas feed into a big, tannic palate with monster fruit that's fairly herbal in character. This is a pounding wine that eschews elegance for black-fruit power, and along the way it's rubbery and a bit scratchy.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Reserve Malbec (Maipo Valley)

description: Electric purple in color, this powerful wine opens with jammy, loud aromas of boysenberry and herbal qualities. Likewise, spunky berry flavors are herbal in nature. Minty oak and medicinal notes dominate a rubbery, long finish.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Barrel Select Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Electric purple in color, this powerful wine opens with jammy, loud aromas of boysenberry and herbal qualities. Likewise, spunky berry flavors are herbal in nature. Minty oak and medicinal notes dominate a rubbery, long finish.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Barrel Select Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Aromas of citrus, green bean and grittiness settle on an even narrower palate, which is lemony and linear in feel and tastes like tart citrus, mostly grapefruit. Lemon and grapefruit flavors linger on a finish that offers no variation.
title: Calcu 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Earthy raspberry aromas are basic and friendly. This feels just juicy enough but not too pushy, with a medium body and a modicum of elegance. Flavors of baked plum, berry and loamy earth finish roasted but largely fruity.
title: Chilcas 2011 Reserva Syrah (Maule Valley)

description: Earthy raspberry aromas are basic and friendly. This feels just juicy enough but not too pushy, with a medium body and a modicum of elegance. Flavors of baked plum, berry and loamy earth finish roasted but largely fruity.
title: Chilcas 2011 Reserva Syrah (Maule Valley)

description: Ripe, rugged, leathery berry and plum aromas set up a tight, rubbery palate. This tastes good, albeit different than your average Malbec—it's a bit citrusy, with orange peel and reedy cherry and plum notes. On the finish this clamps down with tannic grip.
title: Pura 8 2014 Reserve Malbec (Rapel Valley)

description: Ripe, rugged, leathery berry and plum aromas set up a tight, rubbery palate. This tastes good, albeit different than your average Malbec—it's a bit citrusy, with orange peel and reedy cherry and plum notes. On the finish this clamps down with tannic grip.
title: Pura 8 2014 Reserve Malbec (Rapel Valley)

description: Spicy leafy red-berry aromas open this Carmenère. On the palate, this smacks with dry hard tannins. Flavors of herbal cherry and black plum finish with a touch of heat and abrasive yet chewy tannins.
title: Morandé 2014 Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Leathery red berry aromas move to dark fruit after sitting in the glass. This Malbec is jammy in feel, but overall it's fresh. Earthy flavors of spiced plum, baked berry and salt finish toasty, woody and briny.
title: Santa Carolina 2011 Reserva de Familia Malbec (Rapel Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of black cherry and blackberry come with hints of leafy herbs and a shot of alcohol. This four-grape blend is well structured but a touch tannic. Flavors of baked black fruits, herbs and olives finish savory, with plenty of unabsorbed oak.
title: MontGras 2013 Quatro Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of black cherry and blackberry come with hints of leafy herbs and a shot of alcohol. This four-grape blend is well structured but a touch tannic. Flavors of baked black fruits, herbs and olives finish savory, with plenty of unabsorbed oak.
title: MontGras 2013 Quatro Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Leesy, toasty opening aromas accent melon, flower blossom and stone fruit scents. This is woody but healthy in feel, with acidic lift. Flavors of resiny, briny melon and peach finish with a wave of barrel-driven vanilla, but overall this shows coastal freshness and proper balance.
title: Santa Ema 2013 Amplus Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)

description: Ripe and earthy aromas of black cherry and blackberry are lush and dense on the nose. The palate follows suit with a full mouthfeel, but retains adequate acidity for balance. Flavors of gravel-tinged black fruit, baking spice and carob finish ripe and easy. Drink now.
title: Arboleda 2012 Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Ripe and earthy aromas of black cherry and blackberry are lush and dense on the nose. The palate follows suit with a full mouthfeel, but retains adequate acidity for balance. Flavors of gravel-tinged black fruit, baking spice and carob finish ripe and easy. Drink now.
title: Arboleda 2012 Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)

description: If you don't mind a touch of herbal pickle and rhubarb on both the bouquet and palate, then this inexpensive Carmenère will do the job. It offers modest red plum and herbal flavors with a bit of tartness and spice. Has good texture and overall balance.
title: Santa Rita 2005 120 Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Tarry, gritty, earthy aromas of tomato, herbs and cherry feed into a juicy, hard-driving, acidic palate. Flavors of boysenberry and tart currant finish peppery, with a hint of cocoa as well as modest heat and scour. This is racy and shows coastal brightness. Drink through 2017.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2012 Marea Syrah (Leyda Valley)

description: Tarry, gritty, earthy aromas of tomato, herbs and cherry feed into a juicy, hard-driving, acidic palate. Flavors of boysenberry and tart currant finish peppery, with a hint of cocoa as well as modest heat and scour. This is racy and shows coastal brightness. Drink through 2017.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2012 Marea Syrah (Leyda Valley)

description: Big, oaky and toasty on the nose, and then zesty and pithy in the mouth, with citrus, tangerine, lemon and not much else. Call it a one-trick pony and get ready for citrusy flavors and little variation on that theme. The good thing is, for a Maule Chard it plays its hand right.
title: Viña el Aromo 2008 Barrel Selection Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Herbal aromas teeter on herbaceous, with bell pepper, rosemary and thyme scents running on top of raspberry and rhubarb. This is full bodied and a bit oaky tasting, with campfire, herbal berry and roasted flavors. A hot finish with bacon, mint and toast is the close.
title: Tres Palacios 2011 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This small-production Syrah from Aconcagua (250 cases) is rosy and rusty in color, with leathery, roasted, almost cheesy aromas of spicy, savory berry fruits. The palate shows tomatoey zest along with herbal, brambly, spicy flavors of plum and raspberry. On the finish, this is rooty, herbal and tomatoey in flavor, with a touch of chocolate and a foresty quality. Drink through 2019.
title: Von Siebenthal 2010 Carabantes Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Viu 1 is pure Malbec, and this rendition is one of the more ripe and jammy versions on record. The color is pitch black, the nose is saturated and fully extracted, and the feel is almost syrupy. Flavors of prune and blackberry finish heavy and oaky, with a lasting note of raisin. Tasted three times with mostly consistent results.
title: Viu Manent 2010 Viu 1 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: Kudos to Santa Rita for harnessing the inherent qualities of the '07 vintage and applying them to this very nice Carmenère. The wine is bold and loud, but controlled and balanced. It starts with rowdy black fruit and folds in cassis, pepper, bitter chocolate and some smoked meat and olive. Drink now and over the next year or two.
title: Santa Rita 2007 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Kudos to Santa Rita for harnessing the inherent qualities of the '07 vintage and applying them to this very nice Carmenère. The wine is bold and loud, but controlled and balanced. It starts with rowdy black fruit and folds in cassis, pepper, bitter chocolate and some smoked meat and olive. Drink now and over the next year or two.
title: Santa Rita 2007 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: In every vintage this blend of Cabernet, Malbec, Merlot and Carmenère gets a little better, and the 2005 is the best yet. It's a ripe one for sure, with licorice, kirsch and earthy warmth on the nose. The body is big and the wine tastes of berry jam, licorice and chocolate. Balanced and long, with bitter espresso on the finish. Drink now through 2010.
title: MontGras 2005 Quatro Reserva Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Raspberry, plum and spice aromas are simple but solid and approachable. In the mouth, this blend is grabby and tannic, but boosted by good acidity. Flavors of raw oak and related resin are spicy and blanket standard black-fruit flavors, while pinching tannins and residual oak are prominent on the finish.
title: Indomita 2013 Duette Premium Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Lightly candied cherry and raspberry aromas are fresh. This has a ripe, edgy mouthfeel with modest tannins. Cassis, raspberry and blackberry flavors finish soft and friendly, with enough grip to make this serious.
title: Chilensis 2012 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Lightly candied cherry and raspberry aromas are fresh. This has a ripe, edgy mouthfeel with modest tannins. Cassis, raspberry and blackberry flavors finish soft and friendly, with enough grip to make this serious.
title: Chilensis 2012 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Hard spice, juniper and minty aromas meld with chocolate and blackberry scents. This is chewy and full on the palate, with spicy, minty blackberry and black currant flavors that finish thick, with a woodsy, lightly green aftertaste.
title: Concha y Toro 2013 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Hard spice, juniper and minty aromas meld with chocolate and blackberry scents. This is chewy and full on the palate, with spicy, minty blackberry and black currant flavors that finish thick, with a woodsy, lightly green aftertaste.
title: Concha y Toro 2013 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Bramble and green tobacco notes are part of the bouquet, as is rubbery dark fruit. The palate is smooth in feel but a little herbal and leafy, with a mix of berry fruit and mild green notes.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2006 Casa La Joya Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Baked bean, rubber and lacquer are all too apparent on the nose, and while the wine settles in the glass and loses some of that harshness, it never totally disappears. Along the way there's driven cherry and plum fruit and a minty aftertaste. Imported by Vinecrest Co.
designation: Casas Patronales San Ernesto & Los Olivos Vineyards
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2006 Casas Patronales San Ernesto & Los Olivos Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Merlot smells 100% Chilean, meaning there's green tobacco, olive, eucalyptus and earthy berry aromas draped all over the bouquet. A linear, zesty palate ranks as fresh, while lightly oaked red currant and plum flavors finish with spice and vanilla notes along with tomatoey acidity.
title: Tres Palacios 2013 Cholqui Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Opens with toast and vanilla aromas along with baked apple and oak. The mouthfeel is solid, while the flavors blend barrel resin, pear, banana and macadamia nut. Finishes healthy and clean.
title: Viña Casablanca 2010 Cefiro Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dense, dark and ripe on the bouquet, with coconut, mint, earth, blackberry and herbal aromas. The palate is solid but a little sheering due to pointy acidity, and the flavor profile is pure toast and herbal black fruits. Lasting and varietally correct on the finish.
title: TerraNoble 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Dense, dark and ripe on the bouquet, with coconut, mint, earth, blackberry and herbal aromas. The palate is solid but a little sheering due to pointy acidity, and the flavor profile is pure toast and herbal black fruits. Lasting and varietally correct on the finish.
title: TerraNoble 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Earthy, rubbery berry and plum aromas are within the range of very good and regular. The palate has tannic grip and roasted, lightly herbal flavors of plum and blackberry. Drawing on the finish, with good pulse and power. A nice full-bodied mix of Malbec and Cab.
title: De Martino 2009 Made with Organically Grown Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Maipo Valley)

description: This is meaty, spicy and bold. It feels fresh, clean and slightly astringent, with flavors of wild berry and currant that are a bit salinic. The finish is round, mossy and full. A blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Carmenère.
title: Yali 2010 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is meaty, spicy and bold. It feels fresh, clean and slightly astringent, with flavors of wild berry and currant that are a bit salinic. The finish is round, mossy and full. A blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Carmenère.
title: Yali 2010 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This offers aromas of feral berry, black olive and bell pepper followed by a black fruit flavor that's touched by a herbal note. It starts out better than it finishes.
title: Apaltagua 2011 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Aromas of white peach and apple come with mild oak notes. This feels melony and full, with its body weight dictated by tropical fruits. Briny, salty tropical fruit and corn flavors finish with a lasting note of oak.
title: Montes 2015 Alpha Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Aromas of white peach and apple come with mild oak notes. This feels melony and full, with its body weight dictated by tropical fruits. Briny, salty tropical fruit and corn flavors finish with a lasting note of oak.
title: Montes 2015 Alpha Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Clos Apalta, depending on your point of view, is arguably Chile's best wine. And this vintage is outstanding! Earth, minty spice, ripe berry, minerality and smoky aromas cover the bases. It's superbly structured, with a fine texture and depth. Tastes lush and complex, with blackberry, crème de cassis, fine herbs and tobacco. Finishes classy. Drink now through 2016.
title: Lapostolle 2008 Clos Apalta Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: A blanket of oak sits atop apple aromas. This is healthy and fresh in feel, but regular overall. Salty, lean, lightly oaked white-fruit flavors are briny on a racy finish. This is Chardonnay with 11% Pinot Blanc and Pinot Grigio.
title: Trio 2015 Reserva Premium White (Chile)

description: A lot of ripe apple, creamy butter and pear aromas make for a friendly opening, while the palate is plump and weighty, with toasty melon, citrus and buttered pear flavors. Tropical throughout, but with character and toasty spice on the finish. Ready to drink.
title: Montes 2008 Alpha Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A lot of ripe apple, creamy butter and pear aromas make for a friendly opening, while the palate is plump and weighty, with toasty melon, citrus and buttered pear flavors. Tropical throughout, but with character and toasty spice on the finish. Ready to drink.
title: Montes 2008 Alpha Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: There's not much point in making a reserve-style wine if the barrels are subpar. Aggressive menthol and sappy green-barrel aromas and flavors dominate this wine. There's good weight and texture, just not much in the way of vinous flavor.
title: De Martino 1999 Prima Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Lavishly oaked, the fruit here struggles to make itself acknowledged, and when it does it is light plum-cranberry in aroma and flavor. Quite dry on the palate, the wine finishes tart with woody tannins.
title: Undurraga 1999 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Aromas of freshly cut lumber, complete with some hints of burning sawdust, are joined by caramel and cassis. Medium to full on the palate, where some sweet fruit and oak flavors make a decent impression. There's a hint of alcohol poking through on the finish, but little else.
title: De Martino 1998 Prima Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Aromas of freshly cut lumber, complete with some hints of burning sawdust, are joined by caramel and cassis. Medium to full on the palate, where some sweet fruit and oak flavors make a decent impression. There's a hint of alcohol poking through on the finish, but little else.
title: De Martino 1998 Prima Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A lot of Chilean Cabernets seem to have a distinct weediness to them; this is a perfect example of the style, boasting green hay and herb aromas over subdued—almost stewed—cassis fruit. Some tart acidity keeps things lively on the finish.
title: De Martino 1999 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A lot of Chilean Cabernets seem to have a distinct weediness to them; this is a perfect example of the style, boasting green hay and herb aromas over subdued—almost stewed—cassis fruit. Some tart acidity keeps things lively on the finish.
title: De Martino 1999 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Very light berry and mint aromas open this austere, dry Cabernet. The fruit is dark, but needs more depth and profile to carry the woody presence here.
title: Santa Rita 1999 120 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: This medium weight Chardonnay offered aromas of overripe pineapple and citrus with an odd note somewhere between citrus and varnish. The apple and mild citrus flavors lack vitality, and turn overly tart on the finish.
title: De Martino 1999 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Strawberry and wet hay aromas give way to a sweet berry-flavored attack, but the wine turns tart and almost shrill on the finish. A green, stemmy sensation lingers in the mouth, along with dark coffee flavors.
title: Veramonte 1999 Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

description: Ripe, dense blackberry aromas are lightly herbal, soft and inviting. This is full and a touch heavy in feel, with herbal cassis, blackberry, toast and spice flavors that end with oak grain, additional herbal notes and spice accents. If you want to explore the world of Carmenère, this is a good place to start.
title: Santa Carolina 2013 Reserva de Familia Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Passion fruit, lettuce, grapefruit and tropical aromas get this Sauvignon Blanc off to a nice start. Zesty, speedy and super fresh on the palate, with blazing acidity, this tastes of passion fruit, green herbs and grass, especially on a racy, slightly pithy finish.
title: Montes 2015 Spring Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Foresty berry and plum aromas turn more stalky as this breathes. Dense, chewy and a bit heavy, with rubbery tannins, this Cabernet-Carmenère blend tastes of stewed plum, spiced berry and fig. A mellow, herbal finish with mild acidity is full in body and flavor. Drink through 2018.
title: Indomita 2013 Zardoz Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Foresty berry and plum aromas turn more stalky as this breathes. Dense, chewy and a bit heavy, with rubbery tannins, this Cabernet-Carmenère blend tastes of stewed plum, spiced berry and fig. A mellow, herbal finish with mild acidity is full in body and flavor. Drink through 2018.
title: Indomita 2013 Zardoz Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Earthy, smoky berry and cherry aromas are distinctly leathery and lightly herbal. This feels tight and bold, with cutting acidity. Flavors of toasty oak, herbal plum and black peppercorn finish long, due to blazing residual acidity. In fact, this is a sharp rendition of Erasmo that's not likely to get any more friendly than it currently is. Drink through 2025.
title: Caliboro Estate 2010 Erasmo Red (Maule Valley)

description: Saturated and creamy, but a little flat, dense and short on fruit. Even with its age, the palate is fairly closed and quiet, with hard tannins and modest bounce. Flavors of berry and black plum carry an herbal side note, and the finish is more tannic than smooth. Tempranillo with Cabernet Sauvignon, Monastrell and Carignan.
title: Miguel Torres 2003 Conde de Superunda Red (Curicó Valley)

description: Full and stocky on the nose, with a mild pine and juniper accent. The palate features good feel and thickness, while the raspberry and plum flavors are complete and juicy. Dry and spicy on the finish, and correct within the global pool of Pinot Noir.
title: Gracia de Chile 2007 Reserva Lo Mejor Sereno Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: This coastal-influenced Chardonnay smells of green olive, iodine and sea brine more than fruit. A citric, high-intensity palate is chalky and minerally, as intended. Flavors of dried, briny stone fruits and apple are outright salty like the ocean, while the finish on this new wine from chalk-based soils is woody and briny, with juicy acidity.
title: Errazuriz 2014 Las Pizarras Chardonnay (Aconcagua Costa)

description: This coastal-influenced Chardonnay smells of green olive, iodine and sea brine more than fruit. A citric, high-intensity palate is chalky and minerally, as intended. Flavors of dried, briny stone fruits and apple are outright salty like the ocean, while the finish on this new wine from chalk-based soils is woody and briny, with juicy acidity.
title: Errazuriz 2014 Las Pizarras Chardonnay (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Clean, modest lemon-lime aromas open this citrusy Sauv Blanc. Citrus, nettle, white pepper and jalapeño flavors are direct, while the finish hums with peppery spice and preserving acidity.
title: Viña Maipo 2014 Vitral Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

description: Clean, modest lemon-lime aromas open this citrusy Sauv Blanc. Citrus, nettle, white pepper and jalapeño flavors are direct, while the finish hums with peppery spice and preserving acidity.
title: Viña Maipo 2014 Vitral Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

description: Leathery and horsey on the nose, with cherry fruit and warmth. The palate has some edge and bite to it, with lean tannins in support of generic raspberry and standard herbal flavors. Quick and cleansing on the finish, with another wave of herbal flavor.
title: Undurraga 2008 Aliwen Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Rapel Valley)

description: There's a lot of individuality to this wine, just not all good. The nose has cigar box and over-the-top sweet and baked aromas, yet the palate has a grating, acidic feel but also spice and raisiny flavors. All of it makes you more confused than confident; it has its good traits but seems out of whack.
title: Indomita 2008 Duette Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Oaky stuff, with sawdust, roasted fruit and dark, floral berry aromas. The palate is surprisingly high in acidity and choppy, but lumbering oak adds some heft to the berry fruit and cola flavors that lead the charge. A bit smacking and medicinal, and herbal to boot.
title: Vistamar 2006 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Maipo Valley)

description: Citric on the nose, with cherry and bland earthy notes. The palate has an inoffensive feel and sweet flavors of black cherry and vanilla. That sweetness carries onto the finish, which is also candied. Generally decent but highly regular.
title: Viña el Aromo 2007 Winemaker's Selection Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Herbal, brambly aromas mix with dark berry, mocha and vanilla aromas, while the palate is creamy and soft, with herbal, almost vegetal flavors and not much defined fruit or clarity. Finishes as herbal as it starts, with coffee and green tobacco flavors.
title: Errazuriz 2009 Estate Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: A little mealy on the nose, with apple and melon aromas poking through. The palate is both pithy and sharp, with citric acids providing the basis for grapefruit and orange flavors. Pithy on the finish, with passionfruit notes.
title: William Cole 2009 Albamar Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Snappy and edgy as you give it a sniff, with piercing rhubarb, red cherry and peppery aromas. Shows a bit of cushion and softness in the mouth along with spicy, slightly herbal flavors of red plum and raspberry. Spicy on the finish, with citrusy acidity and dry oak notes.
title: William Cole 2010 Columbine Special Reserve Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Prickly and briney on the nose, with cool-climate crispness to the aromatics. The palate is smooth and fairly thick, with a sticky, grabby mouthfeel and sweet, lightly green and herbal flavors of cherry and plum. Full but flattens on the finish.
title: Viu Manent 2010 Secreto Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Mildly green and herbal on the nose, with bell pepper, oregano, black plum and berry aromas. Concentrated and tight in the mouth, with firmness, some burn and round, dark flavors of baked berry and toasty oak. Heavy and chocolaty on the finish.
title: Siegel 2010 Crucero Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Mildly green and herbal on the nose, with bell pepper, oregano, black plum and berry aromas. Concentrated and tight in the mouth, with firmness, some burn and round, dark flavors of baked berry and toasty oak. Heavy and chocolaty on the finish.
title: Siegel 2010 Crucero Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Rich, oaky aromas of coconut and vanilla are matched by earthy, almost nutty berry and cassis scents. This is tannic, grabby and slightly abrasive, while chocolate, cherry and cassis flavors end long, strong and ripe. Drink through 2018.
title: Matetic 2012 Corralillo Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: For an inaugural effort, this coastal Pinot Noir is on the money. Dark and slightly charred-smelling on the nose, the wine is not shy. Full, oaky and moderately tannic, it shows roasted plum, char and toasty flavors in front of a brawny, oaky finish. Best from late 2015 through 2017.
title: Koyle 2012 Costa Pinot Noir (Colchagua Valley)

description: Cherry, plum, berry and cassis aromas are standard and well presented. A full, approachable and balanced palate is home to ripe flavors of blackberry and cassis. For the price, this wine is generous, balanced and lasting.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2012 Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Cherry, plum, berry and cassis aromas are standard and well presented. A full, approachable and balanced palate is home to ripe flavors of blackberry and cassis. For the price, this wine is generous, balanced and lasting.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2012 Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Bright and zesty on the nose, this wine boasts an aromatic emphasis of passion fruit and citrus. The palate shows tension, with ringing acidity, while lime, green mango, grapefruit and passion fruit flavors finish fresh and racy.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 La Joya Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Rubber, Band-Aid and iodine aromas mix with berry fruit and plum on the nose of this blend. The mouthfeel is choppy and light, while blackened flavors of blackberry and plum finish somewhat bitter.
title: De Martino 2010 Legado Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Maipo Valley)

description: Simple but friendly aromas of green fruits and spring vegetables set up a lemony feeling palate, with flavors of lime, green apple and herbs. This shows pyrazines on a juicy finish, but not so much that the wine comes across green, vegetal or bitter.
title: Santa Ema 2013 Select Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Berry and currant aromas are jumpy and fruity in nature, while in the mouth, creamy oak creates a sticky feel. Candied, barrel-driven flavors of vanilla and clove outlast the wine's fruit content on the finish.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Dusty, earthy plum and berry aromas are a touch leafy and suggestive of sea shells. A fresh palate features enough body to handle racy acidity, while this tastes of plum, brown sugar and spicy oak. A steady finish turns over no new stones.
title: Undurraga 2015 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dusty, earthy plum and berry aromas are a touch leafy and suggestive of sea shells. A fresh palate features enough body to handle racy acidity, while this tastes of plum, brown sugar and spicy oak. A steady finish turns over no new stones.
title: Undurraga 2015 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Edgy aromas of plum, cherry and cassis are fresh but scratchy. In the mouth, this Carmenère-led blend shows blazing, cutting acidity and racy flavors of cranberry and pie cherry. Oak and vanilla show up on the finish, which is acidic and fresh, much like the rest of the wine.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Amplus One Red (Peumo)

description: This is adequately pungent on the nose, with a touch of the veggies. The palate is modest in acidity but not flat or flabbby. Flavors of green fruits mix with a hint of asparagus, while controlled capsicum and bitterness work the finish.
title: Anakena 2013 Tama Vineyard Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Forceful aromas of pie crust and heavy berry fruits are clumsy but generous. There's elastic tightness to the palate along with herbal berry flavors. The finish loses fruit while cranking up the toasty afterburners.
title: Santa Alicia 2012 Reserva Shiraz (Maipo Valley)

description: Fresh on the nose, this blend of Carmenère and Merlot is also a bit green and scratchy. In the mouth, this is more crisp than heavy, with choppy acidity and tannins. Flavors of leafy berry fruits are herbal, but there's a vanilla and olive offset that keeps things level.
title: Oveja Negra 2011 Reserva Carmenère-Merlot Red (Maule Valley)

description: Leafy, spicy red-berry aromas suggest asphalt. This is pleasant on the palate, with rubbery tannins. Flavors of rose water, raspberry and plum are light and floral, while the finish is easygoing.
title: Undurraga 2012 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Maipo Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of tobacco, olive, tree bark and lemon peel are herbal and a bit green. This is a blend of Cab Sauvignon, Merlot, Carmenère and Lagrima Christi; it's fairly minty on the flavor profile, with olive and overt oak leading the way. A resiny, green-tasting finish is drawing but fair.
title: Balduzzi 2010 Grand Reserve Red (Maule Valley)

description: Plum and raspberry aromas are fresh, clean and simple. This is a solid, full-bodied Cabernet with currant and plum flavors accented by notes of herbs and spices. A minty, lightly herbal finish feels fresh and healthy.
title: Santa Ema 2012 Select Terroir Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This is fresh, with good pungency and a mix of passion fruit and bell pepper aromas. A scouring mouthfeel pulls no punches, while grassy, slightly bitter flavors of arugula and lemon-lime finish citrusy and tangy.
title: Montes 2013 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Snappy red-berry aromas are true to the variety, but there's also a leathery, roasted stalkiness to the nose. It feels round, chunky and creamy, with baked berry and toasted flavors. It finishes round, full and creamy in feel, with a peppery note.
title: Montes 2010 Alpha Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is purple in color, with a saturated, rubbery aroma that folds in notes of leather, chocolate and blackberry. It's full and lush, with flavors of lemon, grainy oak, coffee and charred black fruit. Dark, oaky and charred on the finish, it needs a lot of air. Predominantly Malbec, with small additions of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Koyle 2010 Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: This purple Carignan smells jammy, with an infusion of raw oak. In the mouth, high acidity creates ample energy to balance the full body and structured tannins. Flavors of ripe blackberry and plum linger on the robust finish. Drink through 2022.
title: Odfjell 2015 Orzada Made With Organic Grapes Carignan (Maule Valley)

description: This purple Carignan smells jammy, with an infusion of raw oak. In the mouth, high acidity creates ample energy to balance the full body and structured tannins. Flavors of ripe blackberry and plum linger on the robust finish. Drink through 2022.
title: Odfjell 2015 Orzada Made With Organic Grapes Carignan (Maule Valley)

description: Gritty aromas of tire rubber, burnt meat and herbal black fruits introduce a grabby palate with lightly herbal but heavily oaked flavors of plum and berry. A firm snappy finish tastes a touch salty as well as minty. Drink through 2024.
designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Blackberry, vanilla and minerally aromas give this solidity on the nose. A high-acid palate is a bit shrill, which amplifies tangy red raspberry and plum flavors. On the finish, this rides high and fast on a lasting beam of acidity.
title: Chilensis 2012 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Jammy berry aromas are slightly exotic. The palate has a wide yet acidic feel that lacks depth and structure. Blocky flavors of plum and berry are tangy and simple, while the finish fails to evolve past chunky and static.
title: Viña Maipo 2011 Vitral Reserva Red (Rapel Valley)

description: This is a highly herbal Cab with strong aromas of juniper and pyrazines. The palate feels full but tannic, while leafy, dry, roasted berry flavors finish with baked notes and a lasting herbal flavor.
designation: Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled
title: Santa Alicia 2011 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: At first this Merlot-led blend is heavily charred and toasty on nose, but with time baked berry aromas rise up. A full palate features a lactic note offset by jagged acidity, while toasty, herbal flavors include berry, mint and wood resin. This is Merlot, Shiraz, Tempranillo and Viognier.
title: Palo Alto 2012 Reserva II Red (Maule Valley)

description: Talk about a sharp wine; this almost socks you in the nose upon taking a whiff. It's full of citrus and jalapeño aromas, which are backed by sizzling bell pepper, serrano chili and lime flavors. Expect a raw feeling and super crisp finish.
title: Errazuriz 2012 Aconcagua Costa Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

description: This is a standard SB that was made for near-term quaffing. The nose delivers citrus and oceanic crispness, while in the mouth it's modest, with white pepper, green bean, bell pepper and citrus flavors. On the finish, it's citrusy at first but then slips toward bitter tasting.
title: Siegel 2012 Crucero Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: This is a standard SB that was made for near-term quaffing. The nose delivers citrus and oceanic crispness, while in the mouth it's modest, with white pepper, green bean, bell pepper and citrus flavors. On the finish, it's citrusy at first but then slips toward bitter tasting.
title: Siegel 2012 Crucero Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: A sappy combo of spiced tomato, cinnamon and candied aromas makes for a sketchy nose. This blend of Syrah, Cabernet and Carmenère feels raw, while forced flavors of buttery oak clash with herbal berry fruit. Green and herbaceous on the finish.
title: La Playa 2014 Estate Series Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of burnt wood, saline solution and mealy fruit do not impress. This feels both resiny and acidic, while flavors of oak and salty white fruits finish with a final coating of unappealing oak.
title: Veranda 2015 Chardonnay (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Yeasty, pyrazinic aromas are strained and less than clean. This feels chunky, with moderate acidic cut. Generic citrus flavors quickly turn bitter, while the finish is weak in constitution, an indication that this has nowhere to go but down.
title: Finca Patagonia 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Cherry and plum aromas lack purity and turn more earthy, horsey and unclean upon airing. Sharp, cutting acidity creates and jagged palate, while flavors of sour black plum and cherry finish with saucy notes on a choppy, short finish.
title: Kunza 2014 Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: A heavily pickled-smelling nose includes aromas of sea brine and vinegar. Narrow on the palate, this SB tastes of sour tangerine and green beans. Salty, briny and tart on the finish, with a note of yellow mustard.
title: Indomita 2015 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: A heavily pickled-smelling nose includes aromas of sea brine and vinegar. Narrow on the palate, this SB tastes of sour tangerine and green beans. Salty, briny and tart on the finish, with a note of yellow mustard.
title: Indomita 2015 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Rubbery, resiny aromas are borderline unpleasant. This feels heavy and cidery, while stalky, pickled, woody flavors dominate. An oaky, briny tasting finish leaves little room for platitudes.
title: Indomita 2015 Duette Premium Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Deep in color, this rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon lacks zip and zest on a lazy nose. A chunky, grabby mouthfeel gives off the sensation of grape skins, while this tastes a bit foxy and herbal, with little to no fruit character.
title: Autoritas 2015 Shiraz-Cabernet Rosé (Central Valley)

description: This Riesling-led blend smells pithy and bitter. It's generic and blocky on the palate, with flavors of white mushroom and bitter citrus fruits. Grapefruit pith and orange rind flavors drive the finish. Tasted twice with similar findings.
title: Santa Rita 2014 Secret Reserve White (Central Valley)

description: Cool, herbal aromas of blueberry are unusual. This is blocky in feel, with a low level of finesse. Candied, herbal cherry and medicinal berry flavors finish with mint and spice notes along with a green character.
title: Porta 2015 Estate Bottled Reserva Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: If forced to drink too much of this clumsy, grassy, horsey smelling blend, you might be a dissident, too. This is sticky and cloying on the palate, with sweet, candied, herbal black-fruit flavors that finish under a covering of residual sugar.
title: Dissident 2014 Reserve Red (Curicó Valley)

description: If you know Elqui, than this funky wine's murky, stewy, muddy aromas won't come as a shock. In the mouth, this is soft and mushy, with little to no noticeable acidity. Flavors of burnt leaves and stalky berry fruits offer minimal punch, while the finish tastes stewy and rooty, which is nothing unusual for northerly Elqui.
title: Elqui Wines 2013 Limited Release Pinot Noir (Elqui Valley)

description: Creamy oak matches prickly red plum and cherry aromas. This is tight and rugged in feel, with black plum, herb, spice and dry oak flavors. A toasty finish loses its fruit quickly.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Shiraz (Central Valley)

description: Shows a prickly side that's true to the variety. Smells and tastes slightly salinic, but also shows good verve and mouthfeel. This is a lively style of SB with citrus and green-apple flavors. It finishes with edgy gooseberry and seems committed to the crisp, lean style (even from warmer Maule Valley).
title: Palo Alto 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Fresh and composed, with aromas of asparagus, mineral and citrus. The palate is mild and balanced, with green-infused flavors that hint at bell pepper, green apple and garden-fresh herbs. Slightly pithy and peppery on the tail end, but honest as Casablanca SBs go. Good for quaffing.
title: MontGras 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: True aromas of green fruit and grapefruit send it off in the right direction. For Maule SB, this is pretty lively and refreshing. The palate features zesty green-apple flavors backed by a jumpy, agile finish. Nothing special but good while it's young and fresh.
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: True aromas of green fruit and grapefruit send it off in the right direction. For Maule SB, this is pretty lively and refreshing. The palate features zesty green-apple flavors backed by a jumpy, agile finish. Nothing special but good while it's young and fresh.
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: The nose on this blend of Syrah, Cabernet, Merlot and Malbec is concentrated, with herbal hints of juniper along with brandied berry and cherry. This is firm and tannic, with deep, earthy flavors of licorice, mint and spiced black fruits. It's grabby and big throughout, with all the nutmeg, anise and wood spice the wine can take.
title: Estampa 2009 Gold Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Malbec Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: The nose on this blend of Syrah, Cabernet, Merlot and Malbec is concentrated, with herbal hints of juniper along with brandied berry and cherry. This is firm and tannic, with deep, earthy flavors of licorice, mint and spiced black fruits. It's grabby and big throughout, with all the nutmeg, anise and wood spice the wine can take.
title: Estampa 2009 Gold Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Malbec Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Stewed red berries and an herbal streak define the nose, which also offers carob and spice notes. The palate feels mostly deep and padded, with layering and flavors of herbs, pepper, spice and plum. A meaty, herbal finish with a tomato paste quality is the final act.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Max Reserva Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Minerally opening aromas yield to a tight collection of green herb and citrus scents that steer clear of anything feline or grassy. This offers shear, zesty flavors of gooseberry, lime and tarragon in front of a stony feeeling finish that's crisp but not grating.
title: San Pedro 2012 Castillo de Molina Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: This is seriously spicy on the bouquet, where a mix of earth, pepper, herbal notes and cassis set up a stocky body with a condensed feel and ample oak. Heavy black-fruit flavors are hard at first but settle well, leaving mint and licorice notes along with a dark, toasty, herbal finish.
designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
title: Viña Bisquertt 2010 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Seductive aromas of blueberry, oregano and juniper are different than the norm. This is concentrated and inky, with intense black-fruit flavors as well as notes of juniper berry and lemony oak. A lush, fruity finish is pure and jammy but not overly complex. Drink through 2016.
title: Chilcas 2010 Las Almas Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Seductive aromas of blueberry, oregano and juniper are different than the norm. This is concentrated and inky, with intense black-fruit flavors as well as notes of juniper berry and lemony oak. A lush, fruity finish is pure and jammy but not overly complex. Drink through 2016.
title: Chilcas 2010 Las Almas Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Olive, herb and earth aromas vie with foresty fruit aromas, while the palate is rough and ready, with rugged tannins and full flavors of baked fruit, caramel, herbs and chocolate. A catchy blended wine with a sweet finish and tons of flavor. Cabernet is the main player here; drink now through 2012.
title: Altaïr 2006 Sideral Red (Rapel Valley)

description: Smells a little jumbled out of the chute, but in no time it rounds into form. The nose turns out to be rich, jammy and convincing, while the palate is robust and features ripe plum and berry flavors. For bold fruit, vigor and drive, this answers the call. It could probably stand to be more elegant and nuanced, but as is it's a fine mix of Carmenère, Cabernet and Syrah.
title: Antiyal 2006 Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Oily, uric aromas of nettle and cactus are at the forefront. This shows reasonable mouthfeel and citric kick, while briny, salty, pyrazinic flavors of citrus fruits finish chalky, salty and sharp.
title: William Cole 2015 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This wine has an overtly oaky nose. Following suit, the palate is resiny and sticky in feel, with little fruit flavor but a whole lot of cheap-tasting wood character.
title: Santa Ema 2013 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a vegetal SB, no two ways about it. Aromas of canned beans and peas are greener than Ireland. Flavors of asparagus, canned peas and citrus finish soft, with low acidity.
title: Piggy Bank 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Raw and green from the opening shot, this smells like bell pepper and wood. The jumbled palate is abrasive, while severely green flavors of olives, herbs, weeds and dried red fruits finish scratchy.
title: Balduzzi 2013 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Jammy aromas are accented by hints of mint, animal hide and cinnamon. This feels wide, grabby and low in acidity. Rubbery flavors of baked plum, chocolate and baking spices finish flat.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of sandalwood and Middle Eastern spices feed into a creamy palate with little to no acidic cut. Flavors of caramel and milk chocolate rest on one side of a flavor void, while herbal, green notes reside on the other side, while the finish is resiny and lactic.
title: Cucao 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Murky, muddled aromas of ground peanuts, worn leather and stewed plum are a good measure of what's to come. This Malbec feels wide, with zero structure. Heavy, loamy flavors suggest cooked blackberry and prune, while the finish is thick and chunky, with a continuation of strange flavors.
title: Santa Luz 2014 Alba Malbec (Central Valley)

description: One sniff is all that's necessary to identify underripe, grassy aromas of green bean. Hard and tangy in feel, this tastes a lot like canned beans, as if pyrazines were sucked from early harvested grapes.
title: Santa Carolina 2015 Specialties Ocean Side Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

description: Stewy, herbal, oaky aromas cover stalky berry scents. This is soupy on the palate, with a strange blend of stalky, burnt, bitter flavors. A charred, green, lactic finish is difficult to wade through.
title: Falernia 2013 Reserva Carmenère (Elqui Valley)

description: Aromas of clamshell, tree bark and berry fruits are scattereshot. This has a noticeably sticky, syrupy feel along with candied, sweet flavors of black plum and baking spices. A chunky, sticky, sweet-tasting finish lacks cut and finesse.
title: Beach Kite 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: Roasted, murky and earthy up front, with almost no fruit aromas to latch onto, this breaks up on the palate due to sketchy structure. Saucy, herbal, salty berry flavors finish briny and roasted.
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2013 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: A solid, somewhat generic Cab with sweet cassis and raspberry aromas as a greeting. The palate is a little candied but it rolls out tasty, dense red-fruit flavors. It doesn't sport much Cabernet typicity but it delivers ripe flavors and a smooth ride.
title: In Situ 2006 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: At first the raspberry and plum aromas are stunted and the palate seems round but basic. More airing reveals raspberry, cassis and strawberry flavors. In the end it winds up as a friendly, medium-intensity Cabernet that's good for immediate consumption.
title: Odfjell 2006 Armador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: At first the raspberry and plum aromas are stunted and the palate seems round but basic. More airing reveals raspberry, cassis and strawberry flavors. In the end it winds up as a friendly, medium-intensity Cabernet that's good for immediate consumption.
title: Odfjell 2006 Armador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Supermodern in style, with mint, coconut, chocolate and huge black fruit aromas. Powerfully structured and thick-boned, with boysenberry, spice and chocolate in spades. Oaky, broad and layered on the finish, with tobacco, coffee and chocolate finishing notes.
title: Errazuriz 2008 La Cumbre Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Supermodern in style, with mint, coconut, chocolate and huge black fruit aromas. Powerfully structured and thick-boned, with boysenberry, spice and chocolate in spades. Oaky, broad and layered on the finish, with tobacco, coffee and chocolate finishing notes.
title: Errazuriz 2008 La Cumbre Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)

description: This is what you want from Chile. The bouquet of green apple, lime, mineral, sea air and controlled sweetness is impressive while not being forceful. Flavors of citrus, pineapple and green herbs are live-wire, while the feel is stimulating and spritzy. With a juicy finish and tons of zest,this is a lovely, true wine that reflects its coastal San Antonio origins.
title: Undurraga 2008 T.H. Lo Abarca Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

description: Spicy, rubbery, subtle berry aromas come with a hard, smoky element. This is firm, tannic and grabby in feel, with heady flavors of baked berry, herbal notes and overt oak. The finish is smoky, sweet, woody and lightly green.
title: Viña La Ronciere 2011 Quiron Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: The nose is somewhat reserved on this wine from the stylish brand Left Bend, named after the San Andreas Fault, though cherry liqueur, plum jam and red clay do emerge. The scents translate to vivid flavors, though, with cinnamon spice, ollallieberry and black pepper on the palate.
title: Left Bend 2011 Camel Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz)

description: Balsamic aromas come with notes of stewed plum, raisin, herbs and graphite. This is wiry in feel, with high acidity and just enough jammy weight to maintain proper balance. Herbal plum and berry flavors carry a tomato accent, while the finish stays the course. Drink through 2016.
title: Lapostolle 2011 Collection Easterly Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Balsamic aromas come with notes of stewed plum, raisin, herbs and graphite. This is wiry in feel, with high acidity and just enough jammy weight to maintain proper balance. Herbal plum and berry flavors carry a tomato accent, while the finish stays the course. Drink through 2016.
title: Lapostolle 2011 Collection Easterly Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a perfectly good, honest Chilean SB with snappy, pungent aromas of gooseberry, grapefruit and lime. The mouth is racy as it should be, with textbook lime, grapefruit, nettle and pithy flavors. If there's any drawback, it's on the finish, which ends with bitterness.
title: Santa Rita 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a perfectly good, honest Chilean SB with snappy, pungent aromas of gooseberry, grapefruit and lime. The mouth is racy as it should be, with textbook lime, grapefruit, nettle and pithy flavors. If there's any drawback, it's on the finish, which ends with bitterness.
title: Santa Rita 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This opens with hard, charred, rubbery aromas. The palate feels tangy and shear, with jumpy acidity that creates raw raspberry and herbal flavors. The finish is similar: bold acidity, oak-based toast notes and herbal red-fruit flavors.
title: Arboleda 2011 Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Aromas of passion fruit, tangerine, bell pepper and grass lead to a plump palate with soft acids. Flavors of pithy, slightly bitter green fruits, bell pepper and passion fruit end in a modest finish that rapidly loses steam.
title: Anakena 2012 Tama Vineyard Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Bright raspberry and leather aromas set up a tight palate ringing with acidity. That creates a narrow flavor profile with drawn cherry and currant flavors. A minty, lightly herbal finish carries notes of leather and oak-based bacon, which frankly seems a bit forced given the simplicity of the wine.
title: Calcu 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Mild citrus aromas come with green notes. This is a medium-level Sauvignon Blanc without a lot of acidic snap. Melon and grapefruit flavors are friendly, simple and chunky, while overall this shows characterisitcs of a warm, bland vintage.
title: Veramonte 2012 La Gloria Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Fleshy, tropical aromas with a touch of varietal snap set up a green palate with sweet lime and scallion flavors. The finish shows ripeness and tropical notes before turning heavy. Drink this well chilled.
title: Undurraga 2012 U Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: If you want a crisp and clear Chardonnay, then you can do much worse than this cutting, fresh wine. Starts out with neutral pear and apple aromas, which are backed by pithy green melon and nectarine flavors. Fresh on the finish, with juicy acidity. Very straightforward.
title: Echeverria 2011 Unwooded Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: Sweet aromas of wet clay and latex give way to spicecake and standard berry and cassis. Feels layered and round, with good density and balance to go with berry, cassis and mild herbal flavors. Holds steady on the finish. A regular but solid Cab for everyday purposes.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Dark and a touch baked, with blackberry and spice aromas along with carob and creamy oak. Feels solid, saturated and healthy, with weight and herbal dark-berry flavors. Warm and scratchy on the finish, with length and depth.
title: Santa Carolina 2010 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: After an opening that's varietally intense, meaning there's a lot of green herbs, olive and carob on the nose, things turn more fruity and fresh. The feel is racy, a bit high in acidity and superficial, with herbal blackberry, olive and chocolate flavors. Young and lively.
title: Odfjell 2010 Armador Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Inky and narrow on the nose, with jammy red fruit aromas. Has a downward momentum in the mouth, so the body collapses as it delivers stationary, sweet berry flavors. Packs power and weight but doesn't exceed the basics.
title: Calcu 2008 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Inky and narrow on the nose, with jammy red fruit aromas. Has a downward momentum in the mouth, so the body collapses as it delivers stationary, sweet berry flavors. Packs power and weight but doesn't exceed the basics.
title: Calcu 2008 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Chunky aromas of apple and citrus are regular and mellow. Has a more fleshy feel than many Chilean SBs, with apple and grapefruit flavors in front of a round, pithy, mildly bitter finish. Just juicy enough; contains 15% Carmenère for added body.
title: oops 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Stalky aromas are green and low on pleasantries. This has a sticky, dense feel, with flavors of char, sweet plastic, peppery berry and weeds. An oaky, herbal finish tastes candied and feels hot.
designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
title: Santa Alicia 2014 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Pungent, sweaty aromas include match stick and green citrus. Flavors of citrus, melon and green apple mark the palate and finish pithy and bitter, with strong pyrazines.
title: Morandé 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Jammy blueberry notes greet you on the nose. The palate feels heavy and blocky, while raisin, prune and other overripe flavors, yet settles on an herbal and baked-fruit finish. The 2012 vintage was one of Chile's hottest in years, and this shows it.
title: San Pedro 2012 1865 Single Vineyard Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Quiet, generic berry aromas come with a hint of sweet plastic on the nose. It feels snappy, crisp and fresh, with currant and raspberry flavors leading to a balanced, lightly oaked finish with mild herbal notes.
title: Anakena 2011 Tama Vineyard Selection Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Leathery, spicy, herbal berry aromas are a bit feral but remain typical of this variety. Jammy, fleshy and fruity on the palate, this exudes herbal plum and raspberry flavors with toasty, green notes. A minty, chunky, solid finish brings herbal notes that are indicative of the grape.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Marques de Casa Concha Carmenère (Peumo)

description: Briny citrus and green-fruit aromas reflect cold-climate origins. This is zesty yet round, with acidic grit and bite. Green pepper, jalapeño and green melon flavors finish spicy and tangy, like bitter lettuce mixed with passion fruit and tangerine.
title: Matetic 2014 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Initially this Syrah-led blend is reduced and rubbery on the nose, with gritty notes, herbal berry and mineral vitamin-like scents. A full, chunky, generous palate is woody, lightly green and shows creamy oak and plum flavors in front of a smooth, lactic finish. This also contains Malbec and Petit Verdot.
title: Matetic 2012 Corralillo Winemaker's Blend Red (San Antonio)

description: Aromas of burnt leaves, grilled meat and rubber/tar are sort of hard and dominant, but the palate is brighter and fruity, with lively raspberry and plum along with carob and olive flavors. Good but seems slightly stalky/herbal on the finish.
title: Falernia 2007 Reserva Carmenère-Syrah (Elqui Valley)

description: Slightly herbal, but not so much so that the bouquet is off or unappealing. Racy and a little rubbery on the palate, with generic but solid berry and herbal aromas. Long, herbal and only mildly scratchy on the finish. Standard Merlot from Chile.
title: Pacifico Sur 2007 Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: A soft, easy, floral blend of Viognier, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Banana, tangerine, pineapple and pithy dry flavors meet on the palate and finish, creating a fruity, likable, quaffable whole. Drink chilled. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2008 VCS White (Limarí Valley)

description: A soft, easy, floral blend of Viognier, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Banana, tangerine, pineapple and pithy dry flavors meet on the palate and finish, creating a fruity, likable, quaffable whole. Drink chilled. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2008 VCS White (Limarí Valley)

description: Neutral smelling except for some pear and mild apple, while the palate is tangy and linear, with citrus, lemon and green apple flavors. Clangy and ringy on the finish, but solid all around. Drink soon or wait for the upcoming vintage.
title: Viña Ochotierras 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

description: Neutral smelling except for some pear and mild apple, while the palate is tangy and linear, with citrus, lemon and green apple flavors. Clangy and ringy on the finish, but solid all around. Drink soon or wait for the upcoming vintage.
title: Viña Ochotierras 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

description: Aromas of saline and paper mill are not the best or most fresh. It is also a touch out of shape and starting to get old. But the wine's briny citrus and melon flavors are solid, while a pickled tasting finish closes it out.
title: Santa Helena 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Narrow, feline aromas and gritty citrus scents define the nose on this lean wine. Orange, lime and lettuce flavors finish mild, with angularity and a lasting twang.
title: Undurraga 2013 U Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Dry, rubbery aromas are low on fruit. This is pulpy and citric in feel, with flavors of apple cider, brown sugar and caramel. Sweetness carries onto the finish, which tastes mostly of molasses offset by citrus.
title: Emiliana 2014 Natura Rosé (Central Valley)

description: Cherry and plum aromas are generic but largely clean. This tastes sweet and buttery, with creamy, lactic notes which accent cherry and berry flavors. A candied tone of residual sugar creates a sticky sensation on the finish.
title: Bota Box 2014 Pinot Noir (Chile)

description: Roasted berry and plum aromas are earthy and leathery. This wine feels raw on the palate, with snappy acidity. Flavors of herb-infused tomato and briny plum finish oaky and spicy, with a forced note of clove. This blend of Merlot, Shiraz, Tempranillo and Viognier is not your typical Chilean red blend.
title: Palo Alto 2013 Reserva II Red (Maule Valley)

description: Hot pink in color, the palate is open and mild, but unstructured. Simple raspberry and plum flavors finish alert but with a basic finish of red and citrus fruits.
title: Montes 2014 Cherub Rosé of Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Briny citrus aromas are pungent, and in general this runs strong on pyrazines and bell pepper scents. A tight, juicy, firm palate is home to citric flavors of pink grapefruit and orange.
title: Calcu 2014 Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Briary plum and minty oak aromas lead to a sharp palate with high acidity. Tart flavors of red plum and currant blend with spice and tomato notes in front of a saucy, high-toned, high-acid finish.
title: Kenos 2013 Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Gritty and earthy up front, with generic plum scents, this feels hard, tannic and in need of more body. Roasted, oaky flavors of hickory and saucy plum finish dry, woody and hollow.
title: Viña el Aromo 2012 Private Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Gritty and earthy up front, with generic plum scents, this feels hard, tannic and in need of more body. Roasted, oaky flavors of hickory and saucy plum finish dry, woody and hollow.
title: Viña el Aromo 2012 Private Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Tight, minerally aromas of charred oak, vanilla, toast, black cherry and cassis carry an herbal note. A fresh, juicy, layered palate shows controlled rawness, with classic Chilean flavors of spice, green herbs, mint and mixed black fruits. A peppery, blackened finish with toasty, herbal blackberry flavors suggests this is built to last. Drink through 2023.
title: Caliterra 2012 Cenit Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Fleshy, oxidized aromas hint at complexity but fall more toward wheat, wax and waywardness. Round in body, with vital acidity, this tastes of creamy oak, peach, dried apricot and lemon. This French-owned Chilean operation has been striving for years to make Chablis-style Chardonnay in the Andes; so far the results haven't been convincing.
title: William Fèvre 2013 Espino Gran Cuvée Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Strongly briny and raw on the nose, with an insistent aroma of tomato sauce, this cool-region Pinot is austere at first, then dry, raw and snappy by the midpalate. Racy red plum, currant and spice flavors finish dry, with blazing acidity.
designation: Grey Glacier Single Block Las Terrazas Vineyard
title: Ventisquero 2012 Grey Glacier Single Block Las Terrazas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Like most Leyda Sauv Blancs, this pops with cool-climate aromas of bell pepper and grapefruit. It's narrow on the palate, with razor-sharp acidity and green tannins. Bell pepper and briny citrus flavors finish sharp, with a touch of sourness.
title: Undurraga 2014 T.H. Terroir Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Like most Leyda Sauv Blancs, this pops with cool-climate aromas of bell pepper and grapefruit. It's narrow on the palate, with razor-sharp acidity and green tannins. Bell pepper and briny citrus flavors finish sharp, with a touch of sourness.
title: Undurraga 2014 T.H. Terroir Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: A bit sweet and candied on the nose, palate and finish, but good if you like creamy, sweet, vanilla notes in your Cabernet. The feel is sort of soft and soupy, while flavors of candied, gummy red berry and prune maintain enough vitality to bring things home. A lot like a cherry-cola ice cream float.
title: Cameron Hughes 2007 The Flying Winemaker Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Opens with a mix of minerality, citrus and powdery white fruit scents. The palate packs tang and zest, while the flavors of green apple and lemon are lean, crisp and citric through the finish. Fresh but a little sharp and monotone.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Selected Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: This winery is part of the Santa Carolina group, and the Cefiro Chardonnay is toasted and mildly buttery and baked, with spiced apple and mild citrus flavors. The palate is basic but controlled, with a toasty, vanilla-tinged finish. Standard and familiar, but well executed.
title: Viña Casablanca 2008 Cefiro Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This winery is part of the Santa Carolina group, and the Cefiro Chardonnay is toasted and mildly buttery and baked, with spiced apple and mild citrus flavors. The palate is basic but controlled, with a toasty, vanilla-tinged finish. Standard and familiar, but well executed.
title: Viña Casablanca 2008 Cefiro Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A common nose of apple, mild toast and baked corn is about what you'd expect from this brand and Chile. Like its cousin called Cefiro (from Viña Casablanca), it's geared toward apple, spice and vanilla. Not overoaked or forced; good but basic.
title: Santa Carolina 2008 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A common nose of apple, mild toast and baked corn is about what you'd expect from this brand and Chile. Like its cousin called Cefiro (from Viña Casablanca), it's geared toward apple, spice and vanilla. Not overoaked or forced; good but basic.
title: Santa Carolina 2008 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Graphite, deep black fruit, earth and cola aromas make for a full-force, inviting entry. The palate feels lifted and healthy, with a thorough blend of tobacco, herb, barrel spice and ripe berry flavors. Toasty, spicy and long on the finish. High quality for $20 Cabernet.
title: Santa Carolina 2009 Reserva de Familia Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Spicy and dusty smelling, with full-force plum and berry aromas matched by equally potent smoky barrel scents. Thorough in feel, with vivid, oak-accented flavors of wild berry and plum. Round and full on the finish, with lasting resiny flavors that remain after all else has faded away.
title: Ritual 2010 Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Spicy and dusty smelling, with full-force plum and berry aromas matched by equally potent smoky barrel scents. Thorough in feel, with vivid, oak-accented flavors of wild berry and plum. Round and full on the finish, with lasting resiny flavors that remain after all else has faded away.
title: Ritual 2010 Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: This electric-pink rosé of Syrah opens with aromas of yeast, chewing gum and pie cherry. The palate is on the full side, but it's not flabby or awkward. Citric flavors are more generic than specific, while this finishes with a burst of preserving acidity and then a lasting note of spent yeast.
title: Montes 2016 Cherub Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: While there are few varietal Tempranillos made in Chile, this one is mostly positive. On the nose, this is dark, with a chocolaty crust along with patented Los Lingues aromas of olive and herbs. A choppy palate is high in acidity, while flavors of heavy oak, vanilla and herbal plum finish peppery, spicy and scratchy in feel.
title: Koyle 2013 Royale Tempranillo (Colchagua Valley)

description: While there are few varietal Tempranillos made in Chile, this one is mostly positive. On the nose, this is dark, with a chocolaty crust along with patented Los Lingues aromas of olive and herbs. A choppy palate is high in acidity, while flavors of heavy oak, vanilla and herbal plum finish peppery, spicy and scratchy in feel.
title: Koyle 2013 Royale Tempranillo (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dusty, oaky aromas of papaya, corn and green banana precede a full, buttery palate with matching flavors of buttery oak, papaya, creamy vanilla and green banana. Brine and popcorn notes protrude from an otherwise mild finish.
title: Kingston Family 2013 Sabino Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Raspberry and cherry aromas come with touch of floral perfume and smoke. This feels tight, juicy and slightly tannic. Flavors of black plum and wild berries are matched by chocolaty oak, while the finish is sweet in flavor, with ripe, mellow tannins.
title: Oveja Negra 2011 Single Vineyard Syrah (Maule Valley)

description: Plum, wild berry, a note of grass and oak aromas carry the nose on this fresh Carmenère that delivers mild tannins and basic plum and berry flavors backed by woody notes. Modest spice and pepper flavors are simple, making this is a friendly type of red.
title: Viña Maipo 2012 Vitral Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Yeasty vanilla and mild vegetal aromas lead the way on this otherwise neutral-smelling SB. The palate is lively but more generic than specific; flavors of bell pepper and asparagus dot the picture, with lime and grapefruit also apparent. A salty, briny finish may stem from the ground water used to irrigate this desert-origin new SB.
title: Kalfu 2013 Sumpai Huasco Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

description: Yeasty vanilla and mild vegetal aromas lead the way on this otherwise neutral-smelling SB. The palate is lively but more generic than specific; flavors of bell pepper and asparagus dot the picture, with lime and grapefruit also apparent. A salty, briny finish may stem from the ground water used to irrigate this desert-origin new SB.
title: Kalfu 2013 Sumpai Huasco Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

description: Aromas of savory spice and black fruits are mild. This is wide on the palate, with a touch of acidic scour. Blackberry, sweet black currant and chocolate are the key flavors, followed by modest spice and toast on the finish. The wine is good, but low on complexity and character.
title: Rios de Chile 2011 Gran Reserva Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Rubbery and firm on the nose, with generic berry and cassis aromas. The palate is mostly clean, with a candied, almost creamy feel supporting jammy blackberry, cassis and baking-spice flavors. Finishes sweet yet herbal. Pretty much as you'd expect for a 65,000-case product.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Melon and tropical fruit aromas are restrained. This Elqui Viognier feels plump but also a bit dilute in the middle, with a mildly tannic sense of grape skins. Melon and citrus flavors are good, while this feels a bit yeasty and plump on the finish.
title: Falernia 2015 Reserva Viognier (Elqui Valley)

description: Dusty oily aromas of citrus peel, almond and yeasty white fruits come with a hint of oak. This Chardonnay feels solid and balanced, but regular. A mix of oak spice, vanilla and briny peach flavors do a slow soft fade on the finish.
title: Montes 2015 Classic Series Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: This is a workmanlike Cabernet that gets the job done. Standard berry aromas show a spot of oak. Solid but highly regular cherry, cassis and chocolaty flavors finish with a smear of superficial oak.
title: Santa Alicia 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This could very well be Chile's most expressive, interesting white Sauvignon. It's got all those prickly pineapple, passion fruit, scallion and pepper notes that are typical, and also a lot of pure citrus flavors backing it all up. The mouthfeel is zesty and spirited, but there's natural roundness, too. Some licorice adds complexity to the finish. Best Buy.
title: Montes 2002 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This could very well be Chile's most expressive, interesting white Sauvignon. It's got all those prickly pineapple, passion fruit, scallion and pepper notes that are typical, and also a lot of pure citrus flavors backing it all up. The mouthfeel is zesty and spirited, but there's natural roundness, too. Some licorice adds complexity to the finish. Best Buy.
title: Montes 2002 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Calina's first attempt at a super Chilean is successful. The wine, a multiappellation blend, really pops in the mouth. The fruit is ripe and the power is there. However, for someone looking for a reserved red made in the Bordeaux style, something that Chile can deliver, this could come across as aggressive, as the acidity is a bit sharp.
title: Calina 1999 Bravura Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Creamy and lush, with pure peach and pear aromas along with nice vanilla accents. The palate is fairly rich and layered, but it's also properly acidic and, therefore, well balanced. The flavors of pear and butter seem on the money, and the finish is solid and of moderate length. All in all, this is a very good Chardonnay with no overt faults.
title: De Martino 2000 Estate Bottled - Prima Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Creamy and lush, with pure peach and pear aromas along with nice vanilla accents. The palate is fairly rich and layered, but it's also properly acidic and, therefore, well balanced. The flavors of pear and butter seem on the money, and the finish is solid and of moderate length. All in all, this is a very good Chardonnay with no overt faults.
title: De Martino 2000 Estate Bottled - Prima Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: A very tight and meaty wine, with lots of vitality and plenty of rich liqueur-like characteristics. The juicy palate burst with cassis and black cherry, while the finish is equally full force. Clearly Pablo Morandé has found something by mixing Syrah and Cabernet.
title: Morandé 2001 Edición Limitada - 22 Barricas Syrah-Cabernet (Maipo Valley)

description: Passion fruit, tangerine and fresh asparagus aromas are typical of this wine, which has been setting the pace for Chilean Sauvignon Blanc since its inception several years ago. The palate is snappy and busting loose with just-ripe banana and melon, while the finish is textured and long.
title: Concha y Toro 2002 Block 30 Terrunyo Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Spicy plum and olive aromas set the stage for a firm palate. Typical Carmenère flavors of herb, olive, spice and dark plum finish with oaky influences of carob and vanilla.
title: Tres Palacios 2012 Family Vintage Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Soft aromas of melon and papaya are simple and mellow. This is modest across the palate, with adequate acidity. Flavors of melon, apple and banana finish creamy, with tropical-fruit residuals and a sweet note of caramel.
title: Terrapura 2014 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)
