description: The bouquet is wheaty and honeyed, but not all that fresh. On the palate, the wine feels chunky and full, with a nutty flavor of honeyed stone fruit. Melon, honey and hazelnut flavors carry the finish.
title: Aresti 2010 Late Harvest Reserva Gewürztraminer (Curicó Valley)

description: This is a fresh type of Pinot, with a pointy bouquet containing herbal raspberry and nettle qualities. It feels juicy, fresh and lifted due to the acidity, while the flavors of raspberry and herb come with dry, oaky, toasty accents. It's peppery, dry and light on the finish.
title: Apaltagua 2011 Reserva Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: This is a fresh type of Pinot, with a pointy bouquet containing herbal raspberry and nettle qualities. It feels juicy, fresh and lifted due to the acidity, while the flavors of raspberry and herb come with dry, oaky, toasty accents. It's peppery, dry and light on the finish.
title: Apaltagua 2011 Reserva Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Pushy barrel aromas make the wine smell like toast on top of applesauce and baking spice. The palate shows modest acidity and some flatness, while the flavors run toward apple, mango and resiny oak. The finish continues to be oaky, showing a tropical flavor and sweetness.
title: Loma Larga 2011 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Pushy barrel aromas make the wine smell like toast on top of applesauce and baking spice. The palate shows modest acidity and some flatness, while the flavors run toward apple, mango and resiny oak. The finish continues to be oaky, showing a tropical flavor and sweetness.
title: Loma Larga 2011 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This Merlot is dry and scratchy on the nose, with raspberry and spice aromas. It's fresh and clean on the palate, with a quick wave of spicy red-berry flavor. It remains spicy and a touch minty on the finish.
title: Con Carne 2011 Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Black as night in color, this has heavy aromas of bacon, rubber and char that settle squarely on notes of vanilla and creamy oak. The feel is fresh but shear and tight, with flavors of herbal berry and spice, plus a scratchiness on the chewy finish.
title: La Playa 2010 Block Selection Reserve Block N. 13 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Black as night in color, this has heavy aromas of bacon, rubber and char that settle squarely on notes of vanilla and creamy oak. The feel is fresh but shear and tight, with flavors of herbal berry and spice, plus a scratchiness on the chewy finish.
title: La Playa 2010 Block Selection Reserve Block N. 13 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: A note of apple is the most identifiable aroma on the fresh nose. The palate is clean and lean, with lemon, orange, nectarine and mildly bitter, pithy flavors. Racy and not at all oaky on the finish.
title: Tres Palacios 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: A note of apple is the most identifiable aroma on the fresh nose. The palate is clean and lean, with lemon, orange, nectarine and mildly bitter, pithy flavors. Racy and not at all oaky on the finish.
title: Tres Palacios 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Kingston's top-level Pinot Noir has been a consistent scorer for the past three vintages. The 2008 starts with pure raspberry and cherry aromas as well as tea accents, while the textbook palate has a proper feel and tasty raspberry and cherry flavors. Spice notes and integrated oak help it achieve its status as one of Chile's truest, most recognizable Pinot Noirs. Drink now through 2011; 300 cases made.
title: Kingston Family 2008 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Very nice Cabernet with a competent mix of earth, black fruit, olive and toast on the nose. The palate is firm, warm and spicy, with good balance and classy flavors of rich berry and chocolate. Lush, just sweet enough, balanced and long on the back end. Drink now through 2012.
title: Porta 2006 Cima Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Fruit for this Bordeaux blend (it's only 80% Cab) is grown organically in Maipo Valley's San Bernardo Vineyard.  Though the nose is a bit closed, black pepper, dried herb and toast aromas still peek through. A long, tannin-and-char finish punctuates the blackberry, cream and oak palate flavors. It's a little tight now, and will be better in a year or two.
title: Morandé 1999 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Nice aromas of smoked meat, coconut, dried berry fruit and pepper set up a nice palate of concentrated, snappy raspberry and plum flavors. Clean, mildly herbal, nicely spiced and with good mouthfeel and follow through. Shows the mildest touch of creamy oak flavor.
title: San Pedro 2007 Castillo de Molina Reserva Shiraz (Maule Valley)

description: Full, honest aromas of brandied cherry, woodspice and cola are inviting, while the palate is thorough and lively, with good acidity and tannic grip. Flavors of black cherry and cassis are correct and finish with an herbal note and a hint of black olive.
title: Quasar 2006 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Scattered on the nose, with peach and honey notes. More solid on the palate, where bitter orange, banana and honey flavors vie for center stage. Loses some intensity and clarity on the finish, but there's enough vital acidity throughout to keep it moving in the right direction. A good dessert wine for simple settings.
title: Errazuriz 2007 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Peachy and a little sharp on the nose, but the palate is smooth and glides along nicely, and the flavors of citrus, honey and caramel are good and hold form through the finish. You can definitely taste the botrytis here, especially on the finish. Fresh and not at all funky. Drink now through 2013.
title: Viu Manent 2008 Botrytis Selection Noble Sémillon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Peachy and a little sharp on the nose, but the palate is smooth and glides along nicely, and the flavors of citrus, honey and caramel are good and hold form through the finish. You can definitely taste the botrytis here, especially on the finish. Fresh and not at all funky. Drink now through 2013.
title: Viu Manent 2008 Botrytis Selection Noble Sémillon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dusty apple, pear and other dry-fruit aromas give this clean wine a good but basic starting point. The palate is fresh but exceedingly simple in terms of its apple, kiwi and nectarine flavors. Pithy and bitter on the finish, but fresh. Tastes and smells like a standard white Rioja.
title: Falernia 2008 Reserva Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)

description: Quite the floral wine, with blueberry and violet aromas that distinguish it from others. But the palate is sharp and choppy, with high acidity that lends sharpness to the black cherry and raspberry flavors. Stirs interest because it breaks the mold of heavy, black fruit-dominated Syrahs. But it's also strange and not fully in gear. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2008 Reserva Syrah (Limarí Valley)

description: Quite the floral wine, with blueberry and violet aromas that distinguish it from others. But the palate is sharp and choppy, with high acidity that lends sharpness to the black cherry and raspberry flavors. Stirs interest because it breaks the mold of heavy, black fruit-dominated Syrahs. But it's also strange and not fully in gear. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2008 Reserva Syrah (Limarí Valley)

description: Spicy, leafy and dry, with mild red berry aromas. The palate is much the same, with a fresh, acidic mouthfeel and solid, snappy flavors of leafy red berry fruit, pepper and dry spice. Simple but competent wine.
title: Pacifico Sur 2007 Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: Slightly green and candied on the nose, but also showing vanilla and sweet cotton candy aromas. The palate is zesty and kind of jumpy, with wiry berry flavors in front of a hard finish. Has qualities but not a harmonious wine.
title: Viña Ochotierras 2008 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Limarí Valley)

description: Initial aromas of marshmallow and cherry candy give way to toasty, mineral berry scents, while the palate is alert, maybe a bit acidic, with cherry, raspberry and herbal flavors. Tight and peppery on the finish, with a juicy crispness and a slight taste of burnt toast. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2007 Reserva Merlot (Limarí Valley)

description: Fairly hard and closed at first, with a chemical-smelling edge. It opens to show fruity raspberry flavors and a peppery accent, while the finish is snappy and doesn't veer much from the primary palate. Kind of lean and sharp, but not a bad effort.
title: Porta 2008 Gran Reserva Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Open-knit aromas of apple, pear, green melon and mineral are perfectly good, while the palate is high in acid and kick. Flavors of grapefruit, generic citrus and grass are solid, as is the finish, which keeps its line. A snappy, alert, easygoing wine.
title: Cono Sur 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Open-knit aromas of apple, pear, green melon and mineral are perfectly good, while the palate is high in acid and kick. Flavors of grapefruit, generic citrus and grass are solid, as is the finish, which keeps its line. A snappy, alert, easygoing wine.
title: Cono Sur 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Very nice and inviting on the nose, with bold black fruit aromas, spice and leathery notes. Feels full and smooth, with dark flavors of berry, chocolate and savory spices. Long and toasty on the finish, with warmth and power.
title: Ventisquero 2009 Grey [Glacier] Single Block Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Black on the bouquet, with charred aromas vying with pepper and blackberry. Feels good but choppy, with firm acidity and solid flavors of wild berry, plum, vanilla and chocolate. Fades on the finish with class; a pure and appealing blend of Cabernet, Merlot and Carignan.
title: O. Fournier 2009 Centauri Red (Maule Valley)

description: Black on the bouquet, with charred aromas vying with pepper and blackberry. Feels good but choppy, with firm acidity and solid flavors of wild berry, plum, vanilla and chocolate. Fades on the finish with class; a pure and appealing blend of Cabernet, Merlot and Carignan.
title: O. Fournier 2009 Centauri Red (Maule Valley)

description: Stocky, wild and needing to breathe, this is one foxy, jumpy wine with olive, herbal and animal aromas. It's requisitely big and jammy, with mocha and maple flavors accenting dark, driving berry fruit. Pours on the chocolate, oak and power as it unrolls.
title: Casa Silva 2008 Los Lingues Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This blend of Cab Sauvignon, Merlot, Cab Franc and Petit Verdot is heavily oaked to say the least. Early on you must battle through a blanket of woody aromas to get to strawberry and vanilla flavors. Airing gives the wine a milder personality, but a dialing back of the oak treatment wouldn't hurt. Imported by Pelco Inc.
title: Kirkland Signature 2005 Tierra De Chile Red (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Bold and red on the nose, with only mild herbal aromas. That slight herbal character extends to the palate, where red plum and red currant flavors take over. With adequate size and plenty of fuel in the tank, this is no wallflower of a wine. But it is a bit limited and tangy, and the acidity seems amplified.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2006 Hacienda Araucano Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Firm and rubbery, with neutral berry aromas. The palate is medium in depth and length, with cherry and red apple skin flavors. There's also some creamy oak and vanilla on the finish, which adds a sweet character to the final sequence.
title: Aresti 2006 Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Firm and rubbery, with neutral berry aromas. The palate is medium in depth and length, with cherry and red apple skin flavors. There's also some creamy oak and vanilla on the finish, which adds a sweet character to the final sequence.
title: Aresti 2006 Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: A simple, racy wine that's not designed to blow anyone away. The raspberry and cherry aromas are perfectly fine. Ditto the palate, which displays tangy cherry flavors, a touch of mocha and some wayward acidity. Good for current casual consumption. Imported by Racke USA.
title: Espiritu de Chile 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Chilean winemakers liked 2013 for its coolness, and this Malbec-Carmenère blend shows racy acidity as its defining component. Aromas of blackberry and plum are floral and smoky. High acidity makes for a tight, pulling palate with flavors of red plum and oak spice. A muscular finish is still pumping with acidity, so this stays bold to the end; drink through 2030.
designation: Single Vineyard Las Cruces Old Vine
title: De Martino 2013 Single Vineyard Las Cruces Old Vine Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Normally the Maipo Valley produces warm, dull Sauvignon Blancs. But this one has more kick and purity of fruit than most. The nose delivers tropical and melon aromas, while the palate is packed with lime, citrus and grapefruit flavors. It's on the big side and a little clingy on the finish, but mostly it gets things right.
title: Haras de Pirque 2006 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: This Maipo estate is now aligned with Chateau Ste. Michelle of Washington, which doesn't exactly impact this nice everyday Cabernet. Bramble and fresh berry aromas offer an entry, then there's chewy raspberry on the palate along with a grace of vanilla and some warmth. A bone-warming wine for fall and winter.
title: Haras de Pirque 2004 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Surprise! This is a legitimate, true to the variety Pinot Noir from southerly Bío Bío Valley. The wine has dryness and balance, a little wood, and pure aromas and flavors of raspberry, cherry ice tea and chocolate. It's lively and streamlined on the palate, so it will work with food. A definite winner in an emerging category that is Chilean Pinot.
title: Gracia de Chile 2006 Reserve Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: One of Chile's best wines is excellent in 2007. The bouquet is concentrated, jammy and powerful, with Graham cracker sweetness offset by earth notes and leather. Lush and deep across the palate, with classy cassis, blackberry and fudge flavors. Layered and silky on the finish. Drink now through 2014.
title: Emiliana 2007 Gê Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Warm, loamy, baked berry and cherry scents are the lead aromas on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Syrah that also brings a green character into play. Hard acidity makes for a rough palate, while heavy oaking has created flavors of cheese and vanilla as well as spiced berry. Edgy tannins, leftover grit and green notes conclude things.
title: Siegel 2010 Gran Crucero Limited Edition Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Cedary spice notes accent aromas of raspberry and plum on this firm wine. The palate is big, creamy and blocky, with oaky flavors of vanilla as well as earthy plum and red berry. Cocoa, spice and vanilla flavors are prominent on an oaky finish. Drink through 2017.
title: Valle Secreto 2011 Private Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)

description: A steep drop from previous years. This vintage is herbal and strained, with aromas of beets and stewed plum. Feels round and tannic, with plum and cassis flavors that finish candied and gritty in feel. An average wine by Lapostolle standards.
title: Lapostolle 2010 Casa Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Blocky on the nose, with mild heat and burn to go with standard raspberry aromas. Feels full, with a resiny, oak-based thickness in front of chunky flavors of raspberry and plum. Dry, woody and buttery on the finish.
title: San Pedro 2010 Castillo de Molina Reserva Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Solid up front, with minty, herbal aromas that include olive, carob and black plum. Feels lifted and high in acidity, with a sharpness to the mouthfeel along with herbal flavors of olive and green-leaning plum. Fresh but short on the finish.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Estate Reserva Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Roasted and compact on the nose, with a slight burn along with generic berry and cassis aromas. Feels tannic and hard, with herbal, roasted flavors of blackberry and currants. Meaty but herbal on the finish.
title: Casa Silva 2009 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Clean fruit-forward aromas of pear and tropical fruits introduce a smooth, slightly creamy palate with good acidic cut. Citrusy flavors of orange and lime dominate, while the finish is lasting and fresh.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Antiguas Reservas Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Tea, spice and modest berry aromas make for a reticent nose. This feels jammy and spongey, while medicinal, herbal berry and oak flavors veer towards minty green and resin on the finish.
title: Casas del Toqui 2013 Terroir Selection Gran Reserva Carmenère (Peumo)

description: Aromas of berry and cassis come with a shot of raw oak. This is grabby and puts on the clamps, but spicy, peppery flavors of olive, berry and oak are very good in front of a hard, moderately tannic finish.
title: Calcu 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This blend of Syrah, Carmenère and Malbec is better than EW's varietal wines made from those same grapes, which proves that sometimes blends are best. It offers plum, currant and floral aromas before a fairly rich palate. Chocolaty blackberry and burnt notes end with a chocolate-driven finish.
title: Elqui Wines 2013 Red (Elqui Valley)

description: Clean on the nose, with pure citrus and minerality. It's full but not heavy in the mouth, with developed, mature flavors of grapefruit and other citrus fruits. Mildly pithy, green and long on the finish. Not a prima ballerina; this has force and strength along with elegance.
title: Chilcas 2010 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Clean on the nose, with pure citrus and minerality. It's full but not heavy in the mouth, with developed, mature flavors of grapefruit and other citrus fruits. Mildly pithy, green and long on the finish. Not a prima ballerina; this has force and strength along with elegance.
title: Chilcas 2010 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Bold, dark and rubbery on the nose, with a hint of citrus to go with black cherry. This is full, thorough and upstanding on the palate, with black fruit, licorice and cocoa flavors. Comes across sweet and rich but balanced, with a layered, long finish.
title: Matetic 2009 Corralillo Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

description: Bold, dark and rubbery on the nose, with a hint of citrus to go with black cherry. This is full, thorough and upstanding on the palate, with black fruit, licorice and cocoa flavors. Comes across sweet and rich but balanced, with a layered, long finish.
title: Matetic 2009 Corralillo Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

description: Horsey, grassy berry aromas are unconvincing. This is plump but also edgy in feel, with a pronounced but weird buttery oak flavor and marginal fruit character. A leafy, oaky finish includes notes of stalky berry and plum.
title: Kenos 2013 Carignan (Curicó Valley)

description: Nice color and good aromas of berry and plum make this common wine attractive. The palate, while ordinary, is bold, sizable and tastes of boysenberry, spice and pepper. And the finish is mild and concentrated before turning peppery. For a basic Carmenère, Santa Ema has gotten it right.
title: Santa Ema 2006 Barrel Select Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Nice color and good aromas of berry and plum make this common wine attractive. The palate, while ordinary, is bold, sizable and tastes of boysenberry, spice and pepper. And the finish is mild and concentrated before turning peppery. For a basic Carmenère, Santa Ema has gotten it right.
title: Santa Ema 2006 Barrel Select Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: A springy nose of cherry, raspberry and chocolate is a good opener, while the palate boasts a mix of herbs, tobacco, olive and plum flavors. The feel is a high point, with lushness and balancing acidity each making a cameo. Finishes mildly peppery. Good Merlot for the money.
title: Santa Alicia 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Meaty, condensed and full of understated plum and berry fruit. This is a nice bargain Merlot with currant, plum and pepper for flavors, and then a dash of mellow coffee on the finish. With solid core flavors and an integrated mouthfeel, it ranks as a positive wine for the money.
title: Quasar 2006 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Big, baked and round on the nose, with leather and sweet blackberry aromas. Put it on the scale and it'll weigh in as heavy. The flavors are dark and cooked as it centers on black plum and blackberry. Short on finesse but long on size, with coffee and chocolate on the finish. Drink now before it turns even softer.
title: Peñalolen 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The dark color and crusty, wood-based aromas reflect a slathering of oak that comes across sort of lemony, but there's no denying that this Cab has body, tannin and heft. It's a little burnt and heavy on the nose and palate, but black fruit and brown sugar flavors give it enough richness to bring it up a notch.
title: Viu Manent 2006 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: The dark color and crusty, wood-based aromas reflect a slathering of oak that comes across sort of lemony, but there's no denying that this Cab has body, tannin and heft. It's a little burnt and heavy on the nose and palate, but black fruit and brown sugar flavors give it enough richness to bring it up a notch.
title: Viu Manent 2006 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: A bit grassy and green on the nose, probably due to the Carmenère portion in the blend. The palate is narrow but firm, with tight tannins creating some roughness. Flavors of red fruits and green herbs conflict a bit, while the finish is of carob and red sucking candy. Good but a little green.
title: Estampa 2006 Reserve Assemblage Carmenere-Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: A bit jumbled and grassy on the nose, with tobacco and red-fruit aromas filling things in. The palate is correct and solid, with medium tannins, good balance and standard flavors of cassis, raspberry, tobacco and herbs. Some heat to the finish says it needs food. Includes 8% Cabernet Franc and 7% Shiraz.
title: Arboleda 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: A bit jumbled and grassy on the nose, with tobacco and red-fruit aromas filling things in. The palate is correct and solid, with medium tannins, good balance and standard flavors of cassis, raspberry, tobacco and herbs. Some heat to the finish says it needs food. Includes 8% Cabernet Franc and 7% Shiraz.
title: Arboleda 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: This opens with earthy, smoky aromas of coffee grinds and blackberry along with toasted marshmallow. The palate is thick and mouthfilling, with baked berry, spice and chocolate flavors. The finish is minty and herbal, with moderate heat and burn.
title: Casas del Toqui 2012 Barrel Series Reserva Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: This opens with earthy, smoky aromas of coffee grinds and blackberry along with toasted marshmallow. The palate is thick and mouthfilling, with baked berry, spice and chocolate flavors. The finish is minty and herbal, with moderate heat and burn.
title: Casas del Toqui 2012 Barrel Series Reserva Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Grassy aromas blend with notes of melon on a round, slightly flat bouquet. This is chunky in feel, with briny citrus flavors and a lively core acidity that keeps it moving along. Tangerine and bell pepper flavors on the finish are fitting.
title: San Pedro 2014 Castillo de Molina Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Aromas of white flowers are light yet clean. This feels basic, while the flavors are greener and more pyrazinic than the nose indicates, especially on the finish, which tastes of bell pepper and white fruits.
title: Mayu 2015 Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)

description: Aromas of white flowers are light yet clean. This feels basic, while the flavors are greener and more pyrazinic than the nose indicates, especially on the finish, which tastes of bell pepper and white fruits.
title: Mayu 2015 Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)

description: Basic white-fruit aromas are pleasant and uncomplicated. A solid,pithy mouthfeel and flavors of peach, green banana and green herbs conclude with a detectable note of grape skins and citrus pith. This is 85% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay.
title: Estampa 2015 Estate Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: This low-sizzle Chardonnay opens with little to nothing in the way of fruit aromas. The palate is chunky, with squash and bready flavors. A lightly vegetal, bitter finish is plump but low on intensity.
title: De Martino 2014 Legado Reserva Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Aromatically speaking, this is shaky due to murky earthy berry aromas that suggest peanut butter. In the mouth, this is compact and fairly full. Collapsed berry and plum flavors include notes of gritty earthy spice, while this is blocky and pounding on the finish.
title: De Martino 2013 Legado Reserva Syrah (Choapa Valley)

description: Apple aromas are standard, clean and direct. This everyday Chardonnay feels plump, with modest acidic boost. Peach, melon and mild salty flavors finish solid, with no added complexity.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Apple aromas are standard, clean and direct. This everyday Chardonnay feels plump, with modest acidic boost. Peach, melon and mild salty flavors finish solid, with no added complexity.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Hard, rubbery blackberry and black-currant flavors are herbal but settle with airing. This feels round, fresh and fair. Flavors of spiced plum, blackberry, carob and generic spices finish dark and foresty, with good overall balance.
title: Undurraga 2013 Gran Reserva Sibaris Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This Syrah and Carmenère blend is bold but elegant, with ripe, spicy, bullish aromas that tell of what's to come. That would be a muscle-ripped palate with depth. Blackberry, black cherry, spice and blackened toast flavors finish in smoky darkness, with toasty length. This is a serious wine for red meats. Drink through 2025.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2012 LFE900 Single Vineyard Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: This Syrah and Carmenère blend is bold but elegant, with ripe, spicy, bullish aromas that tell of what's to come. That would be a muscle-ripped palate with depth. Blackberry, black cherry, spice and blackened toast flavors finish in smoky darkness, with toasty length. This is a serious wine for red meats. Drink through 2025.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2012 LFE900 Single Vineyard Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: A kitchen-sink blend of five grapes produces an excellent result. Borobo blends Pinot Noir and Syrah with your standard Bordeaux varieties, and the finished product is minty and rich, with coconut, shoe polish and crusty aromas in front of syrupy, roasted flavors of brown sugar and baked berries. Toast and mocha are the finishing notes. A chunky wine to drink now.
title: Lapostolle 2006 Borobo Red (Chile)

description: Saturated and black as night, with floral aromas mixed with earth, juniper and pruney fruit. Meaty and dark flavors ride on a bed of leathery, grabby tannins. Spicy, meaty and a touch herbal on the grinding, tannic finish.
title: Matetic 2008 Syrah (San Antonio)

description: Rubber and earth aromas lead to a mix of berry fruit scents and a pinch of vinegar. It's firm in the mouth, with cranberry and herbal raspberry flavors. Gives about as much as it can but at the same time it shows a tart, basic, mildly herbal DNA.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Selected Terroir Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The nose delivers solid, generally clean berry aromas with lift. The palate is bouncy, shows decent acidity, and bumps along while offering standard red berry flavors in front of a light, medicinal finish. Good everyday Cab for the price.
title: Pepperwood Grove 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Dark, dense and very modern in style, with captivating aromas and obvious richness. At 14.5%, this is big, New World Pinot Noir. But its flavors of black cherry, raspberry and cola nut are elevated and brush up against world class. With a cool finish, steady acidity and tannins, and fine purity, Alazan ranks as one of South America's few top-tier Pinot Noirs.
title: Kingston Family 2007 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dark, dense and very modern in style, with captivating aromas and obvious richness. At 14.5%, this is big, New World Pinot Noir. But its flavors of black cherry, raspberry and cola nut are elevated and brush up against world class. With a cool finish, steady acidity and tannins, and fine purity, Alazan ranks as one of South America's few top-tier Pinot Noirs.
title: Kingston Family 2007 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: The days of the 90-point Best Buy are growing short, so rejoice over this excellent blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Petit Verdot. The nose hits with solid mint, coconut, blackberry and fudge aromas, while the palate is ripe, snappy, alert and full of tasty blackberry, cherry and chocolate. It's clean as can be, with immaculate freshness given its price point. Drink up. Only 500 cases made.
title: La Playa 2005 Claret Block Selection Reserve Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dusty fruit and chemical/plastic aromas are a little off-putting. This feels tight and shows moderate snappy tartaric acid. Flavors of mint, herbs and spiced plum are fair for the variety but green.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Dusty fruit and chemical/plastic aromas are a little off-putting. This feels tight and shows moderate snappy tartaric acid. Flavors of mint, herbs and spiced plum are fair for the variety but green.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Apple and melon aromas are basic. This feels round, with moderate acidity. Flavors of citrus, peach and nectarine are competent, while the finish takes on a salty note as it loses its fruit character.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 La Joya Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Apple and melon aromas are basic. This feels round, with moderate acidity. Flavors of citrus, peach and nectarine are competent, while the finish takes on a salty note as it loses its fruit character.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 La Joya Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Briny nectarine aromas set up a fresh palate. Standard stone-fruit flavors and apple notes finish steady and a touch sweet, with citric acidity.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2013 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of melon are flabby. This is both chunky yet citrusy in feel, while flavors of orange and lemon are basic. The finish is soft but shows just enough citric acidity to keep things going.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
title: Concha y Toro 2013 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of melon are flabby. This is both chunky yet citrusy in feel, while flavors of orange and lemon are basic. The finish is soft but shows just enough citric acidity to keep things going.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
title: Concha y Toro 2013 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Potent black-fruit aromas are forward. In the mouth, this is choppy and punchy. Flavors of mint, coconut and jagged black fruits finish oaky and grabby, with tartness. There are many disparate parts to this wine.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule Merlot (San Clemente)

description: Aromas suggest bath soap, peach and pear. The palate is friendly but blocky, while the flavor profile runs sweet, with a sugary dosage. Hints of nectarine and mango work the finish.
title: Valdivieso NV Brut Sparkling (Chile)

description: Citrus and apple aromas are dusty. This is easygoing and just juicy enough, with apple, orange and tangerine flavors. A clean finish turns softer and more mealy the longer it sits.
title: Valdivieso 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Ripe in color and aromas, this chunky wine delivers heavy baked-berry and raisin aromas in front of a jammy, extracted palate. Raisin and cooked berry flavors finish plump, with earthy notes.
title: Balduzzi 2012 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Pretty on the nose, with mild apple and pear scents. The wine shows good balance and body, with flavors of pineapple, apple and green melon. It's got all the fruit you could ask for, but some of that fruit is of the sweet banana and plantain family. Which for some means too sweet.
title: Veranda 2007 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Fairly big and full-bodied, but not overoaked or overripe, so you get true plum and red-berry flavors, some of Carmenère's herbal side, and a solid finish that offers good spice flavors and proper tannins. Sometimes simple is better, and this wine's no-nonsense approach is what works.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2006 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Fairly big and full-bodied, but not overoaked or overripe, so you get true plum and red-berry flavors, some of Carmenère's herbal side, and a solid finish that offers good spice flavors and proper tannins. Sometimes simple is better, and this wine's no-nonsense approach is what works.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2006 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This wine is volatile and grassy on the nose, and extremely horsey. Odd flavors of mango and pineapple are way out of place, and the finish tastes of bad tobacco.
title: Viu Manent 2012 Gran Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: This wine is volatile and grassy on the nose, and extremely horsey. Odd flavors of mango and pineapple are way out of place, and the finish tastes of bad tobacco.
title: Viu Manent 2012 Gran Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: Yeasty, bland, unconvincing aromas make for an unremarkable opening. This is flabby and broken on the palate, with yeasty flavors of canned peas.
title: Falernia 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Earthy, scratchy, herbal aromas of cassis and raspberry lead to a punchy, wiry palate. Generic cherry and berry flavors are herbal and lightly green, while this is grabby and tannic on the finish.
title: Albamar 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Aromas of vanilla and pear are mild on the nose. This feels heavy and chunky, with low acidity. Vanilla, melon and papaya flavors taste as though they're on the way out, while this soft Chardonnay feels oily on the finish.
title: Santa Carolina 2013 Reserva de Familia Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Peach pit, matchstick and almond skin aromas come across a bit harsh. This is chunky on the palate, with pulpy, pithy melon and lees flavors that take on a briny characteristic on the finish.
title: Rubus 2014 Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Chunky, meaty, saucy plum and berry aromas are green and gritty. This is solid feeling on first blush, but then it collapses and turns clampy and tannic. Minimal berry and cassis flavors battle with herbal, green notes in front of a chubby, imprecise finish.
title: Siegel 2013 Special Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: With a mix of graham cracker, coffee, herb and jammy, unfocused berry aromas, this lacks cohesion on the nose. A fat, wide palate offers no point of focus, while herbal flavors of cassis and olive finish with green notes of tobacco and oregano.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2013 Riscos de Puquillay Alto Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Pithy aromas of melon and apple are low in oak and emphasize minerality. This feels full and chunky, but also acidic. Briny flavors of stone fruits lean toward sour, while an oily, briny tasting finish is short on elegance.
designation: Single Vineyard Block no.5 Quebrada Alta
title: Cono Sur 2014 Single Vineyard Block no.5 Quebrada Alta Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Berry and plum aromas are creamy and spicy while hinting at prune. This everyday Cabernet feels creamy and a touch flat and soupy. Plum and berry flavors are slightly weedy, while this holds steady on a chunky finish.
title: Root:1 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Berry and plum aromas are creamy and spicy while hinting at prune. This everyday Cabernet feels creamy and a touch flat and soupy. Plum and berry flavors are slightly weedy, while this holds steady on a chunky finish.
title: Root:1 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Lime and orange aromas smell more like a household cleanser than honest fruit. A chunky palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of yeast and white bread more than fruit. Bitterness on the finish transitions to yeasty as this fades.
title: Cuyen 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Charred resiny oak aromas dominate herbal berry fruit. This is rough and raw on the palate, with sizzling tartaric acidity and forceful tannins. Flavors of burnt black coffee and herbal plum finish with a ring of excess acidity.
title: TerraNoble 2013 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Charred resiny oak aromas dominate herbal berry fruit. This is rough and raw on the palate, with sizzling tartaric acidity and forceful tannins. Flavors of burnt black coffee and herbal plum finish with a ring of excess acidity.
title: TerraNoble 2013 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Applesauce and woody aromas don't offend but they aren't anything special or enticing. This feels chunky and fairly flat. Woody resiny flavors are low to empty on fruit, while this tastes yeasty on the finish.
title: Las Niñas 2015 Reserva Chardonnay (Apalta)

description: Applesauce and woody aromas don't offend but they aren't anything special or enticing. This feels chunky and fairly flat. Woody resiny flavors are low to empty on fruit, while this tastes yeasty on the finish.
title: Las Niñas 2015 Reserva Chardonnay (Apalta)

description: Bland apple and citrus aromas are oaky, with a note of popcorn. This feels plump and short on core acidity. Melon, applesauce and oak-resin flavors finish flat and with a flavor note of fresh butter.
title: Santa Carolina 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)

description: Aromas of animal hide, rubber and herbal berry fruits are not lovable. This has a heavy scratchy mouthfeel and lightly green flavors of berry fruits mixed with unabsorbed oak. This tastes toasty and blackened on an abrasive finish.
title: Santa Rita 2015 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Earthy mossy spicy aromas are the high point on this edgy rubbery amped-up Carmenère. This is blocky and chunky on the palate, with blueberry and leathery flavors. Lively but rough feeling on a peppery, herbal finish.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2013 Twelvestone Carmenère (Lontué Valley)

description: This yellow-looking Chardonnay smells briny and like oily popcorn. The palate is both watery in feel and resiny. Nutty, salty flavors of popcorn crowd out apple notes, while the finish is dilute.
title: Ritual 2015 Supertuga Block Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This yellow-looking Chardonnay smells briny and like oily popcorn. The palate is both watery in feel and resiny. Nutty, salty flavors of popcorn crowd out apple notes, while the finish is dilute.
title: Ritual 2015 Supertuga Block Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Early aromas are earthy, sort of like coffee grinds mixed with baked fruit. The palate hits with a dose of creamy milk chocolate, while later on berries and vanilla rise up. More of a plump, sweet and unctuous wine made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Imported by North Lake Wines.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2004 Escudo Rojo Red (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a new wine from the Lurton brothers, and it's got good weight, color and integrity. It also shows a lot of hickory and pickle from the oak and some wayward vanilla on the juicy, jumpy palate. Not a refined wine but pretty good for size and zip.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2006 Hacienda Araucano Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: Dusty aromas of tea and dried spices blend well with black olive and black-fruit notes. This wine has a lean but muscular build. Plum and wild berry flavors come with dry, spicy oak accents. Acidity keeps the finish in shape and ensures length; drink through 2022.
title: Kingston Family 2015 Bayo Oscuro Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dusty aromas of tea and dried spices blend well with black olive and black-fruit notes. This wine has a lean but muscular build. Plum and wild berry flavors come with dry, spicy oak accents. Acidity keeps the finish in shape and ensures length; drink through 2022.
title: Kingston Family 2015 Bayo Oscuro Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Berry, cassis, wood shavings and loamy earth are the main aromas. Lightly baked flavors of blackberry and plum come with olive and herbal accents. This is oaky, a touch minty and generally comfortable on the finish.
designation: Novas Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes
title: Emiliana 2011 Novas Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Jammy, candied berry and prune aromas are reduced. That theme continues onto the palate, which feels compacted. Flavors of black grapes, prune, blueberry and black pepper finish with a meaty note of beef jerky, raw tannins and a shortage of body. Very good but with flaws.
title: Casas del Toqui 2013 Gran Toqui Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of spent coffee grounds and herbal plum and berry fruits lead to a palate that's edgy and a bit rough. Herbal plum, berry and cassis flavors come with tobacco and olive accents, while this is dry, pulling and scratchy on the finish.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2013 Los Vascos Grande Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dark, woody, leafy aromas of herbal berry fruits and olive lead to a juicy but monotone palate. Plum, black pepper and burnt toast comprise the flavor profile, while the finish is toasty, blackened and spicy, with a touch of heat.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2013 Gran Reserva Triumpheros Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dark, woody, leafy aromas of herbal berry fruits and olive lead to a juicy but monotone palate. Plum, black pepper and burnt toast comprise the flavor profile, while the finish is toasty, blackened and spicy, with a touch of heat.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2013 Gran Reserva Triumpheros Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Here's yet another wine bearing the signature of winemaker Ignacio Recabarren, and it's a touch thinner and disjointed than one might expect. The nose features blanched raspberry and a strong note of pine or fern frond. The mouth is chunky and plummy, and it evolves with air. But it is also a touch vegetal and never really hits stride.
title: Peñalolen 1999 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This old-school winery sticks to tradition, so if this new-release Merlot seems older than it is, that's by intention. The color is light, and the wine already carries fading edges. The nose is earthy and the flavors are spicy.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2001 Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Pungent aromas of pine needles and saw mill start it off. Next comes a juicy palate with flavors of orange and pineapple. The finish is fine, but it's kind of dull. The is a basic wine that veers toward flatness. But for now it's hanging in there.
title: Dallas Conté 2002 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Simple but clean in the nose, with just a hint of cheesy pungency. The palate veers toward tangerine and pineapple. The finish is sharp and acidic. Best Buy.
title: Carta Vieja 2001 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: At first the tight nose is a bit like tar and industrial cleaner, but once it fans out some black fruit emerges. The palate is tight and tannic, but fresh and ripe. And the finish is healthy but also rather tannic. Good with barbecued meats and the like.
title: Viña Casas del Bosque 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Rough at first, with leathery aromas and hints of bitter chocolate. Which all goes to say: Where's the snappy cherry fruit? It just doesn't seem to be here. What you do get is light raspberry and tea notes, and then some oak and herbal character on the finish.
title: Undurraga 2001 Reserva Pinot Noir (Maipo Valley)

description: This weighty Malbec is more rough than refined, but what's here is decent. The nose is round and full of plum and berry aromas, while there's a full blast of berry fruit along with detectable oak on the palate. The finish is basic and clean, with some buttery oak on the very back.
title: Château La Joya 2001 Estate Bottled Reserve Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: This weighty Malbec is more rough than refined, but what's here is decent. The nose is round and full of plum and berry aromas, while there's a full blast of berry fruit along with detectable oak on the palate. The finish is basic and clean, with some buttery oak on the very back.
title: Château La Joya 2001 Estate Bottled Reserve Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: Full in the nose, with leather and muted red and black fruit. The palate is big and oaky, with flavors of black plum and milk chocolate, and the finish is of modest length, with size and some tannins. This wine has all the typical Merlot characteristics, but in short order.
designation: 35 South Land of Passion and Fantasy
title: San Pedro 2002 35 South Land of Passion and Fantasy Merlot (Lontué Valley)

description: Lean and basic, with fairly ripe aromas and a decent helping of apple, peach and grapefruit. The fruit is a touch soft and lacking in structure though.
title: Valdivieso 2002 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: One whiff and you know what you have. The nose offers wild flower, mustard seed and telltale lychee fruit. The body is fairly rich, and there are flavors of custard, apple, banana and nutmeg-like spice. The finish is simultaneously chewy and fresh, which is a testament to the wine's forward acidity.
title: Undurraga 2002 Gewürztraminer (Maipo Valley)

description: One whiff and you know what you have. The nose offers wild flower, mustard seed and telltale lychee fruit. The body is fairly rich, and there are flavors of custard, apple, banana and nutmeg-like spice. The finish is simultaneously chewy and fresh, which is a testament to the wine's forward acidity.
title: Undurraga 2002 Gewürztraminer (Maipo Valley)

description: Creamy in the nose, with a hint of vanilla and Bartlett pear. The palate isn't boring; there's cantaloupe and nutmeg nuances along with some papaya and banana. The weakness: The wine turns soft almost immediately upon pouring.
title: De Martino 2001 Estate Bottled - Prima Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Dark gold color and buttery nose say that it was heavily oaked during its fermentation and afterward. The palate is flat and resiny. On the finish, buttered toast and some bitter, oaky leftovers hold it back.
title: De Martino 1999 Reserva de Familia Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dark gold color and buttery nose say that it was heavily oaked during its fermentation and afterward. The palate is flat and resiny. On the finish, buttered toast and some bitter, oaky leftovers hold it back.
title: De Martino 1999 Reserva de Familia Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Red berry and spice aromas make up the bouquet on this limited-production wine. Herbal flavors of olive and berry finish oaky, blackened and minty.
title: Emiliana 2013 Natura Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Jammy strawberry aromas are sweet and welcoming on the nose. A bit disjointed, with tangy acidity, the palate brings dark fruit tones of cherry, plum and berry.
title: Emiliana 2013 Natura Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Pleasant melon and pear aromas show sea-spray notes as the wine breathes. The palate is fresh and coastal in feel, with green melon and tropical fruit flavors that finish a touch salty.
title: Lomas del Valle 2013 Coastal Cool Climate Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Oak and mild perfume notes accent red berry aromas on the nose. The palate feels disjointed, with mild, ripe berry flavors and a hint of spice on the finish.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Oak and mild perfume notes accent red berry aromas on the nose. The palate feels disjointed, with mild, ripe berry flavors and a hint of spice on the finish.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Blocky on the nose and a touch cheesy and leathery smelling, with gritty berry aromas and balsamic notes. It feels tight, wiry and powerful, with peppery, minty, spicy flavors lending character to the fruit. This finishes toasty and peppery, with a hint of warmth.
title: Ventisquero 2007 Pangea Apalta Vineyard Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Blocky on the nose and a touch cheesy and leathery smelling, with gritty berry aromas and balsamic notes. It feels tight, wiry and powerful, with peppery, minty, spicy flavors lending character to the fruit. This finishes toasty and peppery, with a hint of warmth.
title: Ventisquero 2007 Pangea Apalta Vineyard Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Fairly crisp red fruit aromas suggest plum, red flower and wood resin on the nose. This is a full bodied wine with plenty of oak. Flavors of berry fruit finish with lasting sweetness and an herbal character.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 La Joya Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Leather and game notes accent standard blackberry aromas. This is jammy and voluminous, but lacks some refinement. Herbal black fruit flavors show a tinge of herbaceousness, while the finish is plump and round in feel.
title: Quintay 2012 Q Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Warm, furry aromas of olive, prune and animal hide are challenging. In the mouth, this cool-year Carmenère feels tartaric and narrow, with grating tannins. Fiery flavors of black fruits, raisin and oak are mildly salty and herbal, while the finish feels hot and tastes of minty oak and black fruits.
title: Errazuriz 2013 Kai Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Warm, furry aromas of olive, prune and animal hide are challenging. In the mouth, this cool-year Carmenère feels tartaric and narrow, with grating tannins. Fiery flavors of black fruits, raisin and oak are mildly salty and herbal, while the finish feels hot and tastes of minty oak and black fruits.
title: Errazuriz 2013 Kai Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Major olive and charred aromas ride on top of herbal black-fruit scents. This is loud on the palate, with probing acidity and mild tannins. The flavor profile is herbal, with stewed plum and blueberry accounting for the fruit components. On the finish, this feels solid and tastes minty.
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2011 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Campfire and hickory aromas dominate the nose on this superficial Carmenère that's round in the mouth but also acidic and showing little structure or stuffing. Flavors of black fruits, herbal notes and wood finish rubbery in feel then bitter in taste.
title: San Nicolas 2011 Victoria Reserve Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: The nose is true to the variety: there's grapefruit and lime aromas along with grassy notes. The palate is solid, maybe a bit plump and vapid, with lemon, lime and other citrus flavors. A bell pepper and jalapeño sharpness comes up on the finish.
title: Terrapura 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: The 2011 vintage was a cold one in Chile and this Cab reflects that. It's pumping out loads of olive, green herbs and oak on the nose, and that's followed by a tannic palate with minty, green flavors of olive, thyme, pepper and generic berry fruits. Not surprisngly, the finish is fairly green.
title: Casas del Bosque 2011 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Raw, earthy plum aromas are spicy and lightly herbal. This feels saucy yet monotone. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors end with a hint of brown sugar and a continuation of the wine's herbal plum character.
title: Chilensis 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Earthy and stewy plum and berry aromas lead to heavy, clunky palate with leafy mulchy berry flavors. End notes of carob are mostly oak-based, while defined fruit notes are lacking.
title: Conde de Velázquez 2013 El Conde Gran Reserva Malbec (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Rustic aromas of grilled meat, leather and medicinal berry fruits set up a drawing, pulling palate with rough tannins. Dark-berry flavors are roasted and peppery, while this is herbal tasting and tannic on the finish.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2015 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: A full, loamy bouquet with minerally blackberry and cassis aromas is modern in style despite this coming from old Maule vines. A generous palate deals woody, toasty flavors of baked black plum and blackberry, while peppery spice and a hint of clove are prominent on an oak-driven finish. Drink through 2021.
title: Altamana 2014 Grande Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Good for Valdivieso that they are willing to experiment with a Mourvèdre-led blend that also contains Carignan and Syrah. This is racy and a bit tangy, with plenty of old-vines acidity making the wine a bit jumpy and scouring. Probably best with food; it's a bit astringent on its own.
title: Valdivieso 2005 Eclat Red (Maule Valley)

description: Rubbery and earthy smelling on first take, with bulky, dark berry aromas mixed with herbal notes. Shows tannic bite and grab along with standard, herbal flavors of blackberry and black olive. Finishes similarly. Good Cab for $7.
title: La Playa 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: A touch green and vegetal on the nose, with hints of canned peas and bell pepper. Fortunately there's enough lime and minerality to keep it fresh. Feels crisp, tight and wet, with green notes pervading core citrus flavors. Finishes pithy and zesty, with mild bitterness.
title: Botalcura 2011 El Delirio Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Full and rubbery on the nose, with berry, prune and foresty aromas. Quite tannic and biting on the palate, with espresso, stewed prune and bitterness to the flavor profile. Finishes hard and unyielding, with a lasting note of coffee-like bitterness.
title: François Lurton 2010 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Syrah (Lolol Valley)

description: Full and rubbery on the nose, with berry, prune and foresty aromas. Quite tannic and biting on the palate, with espresso, stewed prune and bitterness to the flavor profile. Finishes hard and unyielding, with a lasting note of coffee-like bitterness.
title: François Lurton 2010 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Syrah (Lolol Valley)

description: This Cabernet-led blend is Montes' new icon wine from Marchigue in the Colchagua Valley. It is ripe, warm, leathery and earthy, with aromas of aged cheese, tobacco, raisin and cedar. The mouth is hefty and bold, with a mix of coffee and herbal flavors as well as cassis and blackberry. The finish is heavy and a bit raisiny, with depth and density. Drink now through 2015.
designation: Taita Wisdom in Wine Marchigue Vineyard
title: Montes 2007 Taita Wisdom in Wine Marchigue Vineyard Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: This Cabernet-led blend is Montes' new icon wine from Marchigue in the Colchagua Valley. It is ripe, warm, leathery and earthy, with aromas of aged cheese, tobacco, raisin and cedar. The mouth is hefty and bold, with a mix of coffee and herbal flavors as well as cassis and blackberry. The finish is heavy and a bit raisiny, with depth and density. Drink now through 2015.
designation: Taita Wisdom in Wine Marchigue Vineyard
title: Montes 2007 Taita Wisdom in Wine Marchigue Vineyard Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Clean but neutral, with decent lift, zest and body. The flavors run sweet to tropical, with pithy notes and a hint of green vegetables on the finish. Very basic and worthwhile, but regular in every sense of the word.
title: Valle Frio 2007 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Clean but neutral, with decent lift, zest and body. The flavors run sweet to tropical, with pithy notes and a hint of green vegetables on the finish. Very basic and worthwhile, but regular in every sense of the word.
title: Valle Frio 2007 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Rooty and on the verge of being overripe, this is yet another 2006 Cabernet from Chile with hot-weather signatures draped all over it. The nose is baked, while the fruit is all sweet black plum and berry with heat on the finish.
title: Undurraga 2006 Sibaris Reserva Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Oily white-fruit aromas are basic, while the palate has a round mouthfeel and decent acidity. Flavors of brine, white melon rind and citrus finish pickled and bitter.
title: Terrapura 2013 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: Oily white-fruit aromas are basic, while the palate has a round mouthfeel and decent acidity. Flavors of brine, white melon rind and citrus finish pickled and bitter.
title: Terrapura 2013 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: Blackberry and rubbery aromas are also leafy and mulchy. The syrupy mouthfeel is heavy, with baked cassis and prune flavors suggesting overripe fruit. Fig, chocolate and sawdust notes come up on a cloying finish.
title: Primus 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Blackberry and rubbery aromas are also leafy and mulchy. The syrupy mouthfeel is heavy, with baked cassis and prune flavors suggesting overripe fruit. Fig, chocolate and sawdust notes come up on a cloying finish.
title: Primus 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Charred, smoky aromas are dominant on the nose. Strong tannins overpower baked fruit aromas and oaky and herbal tones.
title: Viña Maipo 2012 Vitral Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Crisp apple aromas are light and minerally. Feels citrusy and lifted on the palate, with melon, apple and barrel spice flavors. Mildly oaked but not heavy on the finish, with a fresh overall approach.
title: Chilcas 2010 Reserva Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Neutral on the nose, with modest sweet berry aromas but not much more. Feels heavy and buttery, with baked berry flavors bolstered by loud oak that tastes buttery and creamy. Chunky, ripe, buttery and sweet on the finish.
title: Amayna 2010 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Yellow tinted, which announces that this wine was barrel aged. And that barrel character is huge on the nose, which smells of raw oak, vanilla and dried cheese. Feels creamy, but the acidity is lively as well. Shows flashes of brilliance but also fights to absorb all the wood that's been thrown at it. A quality wine but definitely not for everyone.
title: O. Fournier 2009 Alfa Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: A heavy dose of petrol is the aromatic greeting, and it comes with hints of rubber, latex and waxy white fruits. Feels tangy and fresh due to blazing acidity, while it tastes both of tropical fruits and diesel. Long and chiseled on the finish.
title: Meli 2010 Riesling (Central Valley)

description: Plum and berry aromas are leathery and solid. This feels a bit wiry, but full of energy and sharp acidity. Loamy plum and blackberry flavors are boosted by tartartic acidity, while mild herb notes fade on the finish.
title: Autoritas 2013 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: The variety's requisite citrus and green aromas are on display, but they aren't very defined or exciting. Neither is the wet, chunky palate, which may be moderately fresh but doesn't offer much besides basic pineapple, kiwi and green melon. 270,000 cases made.
title: Santa Rita 2009 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Hardly in the same class as the more elevated Pargua, this second wine is roasted and murky, and frankly a little dirty. It's as if the ripe, healthy fruit went to the $40 Pargua I and the raisiny, heavy stuff to this. Hence, it's candied, baked, syrupy and hot.
title: Viña Pargua 2006 Pargua II Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Hardly in the same class as the more elevated Pargua, this second wine is roasted and murky, and frankly a little dirty. It's as if the ripe, healthy fruit went to the $40 Pargua I and the raisiny, heavy stuff to this. Hence, it's candied, baked, syrupy and hot.
title: Viña Pargua 2006 Pargua II Red (Maipo Valley)

description: An apple pie type of wine, meaning it's got baked apple, cinnamon and pastry aromas and flavors. The palate is kind of soft and sticky, and with little vital acidity it struggles to keep up. Standard warm-climate Chardonnay.
title: Chilensis 2008 Reserva Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Light apple aromas lead to a sweet, mildly candied palate of monotone apple flavors. Acidity is up there, so there isn't any overt thickness or chunkiness to the wine. Rudimentary and quaffable.
title: TerraNoble 2008 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Light apple aromas lead to a sweet, mildly candied palate of monotone apple flavors. Acidity is up there, so there isn't any overt thickness or chunkiness to the wine. Rudimentary and quaffable.
title: TerraNoble 2008 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Herbal and peppery, with secondary aromas of floral raspberry. Snappy and grassy on the palate, with generic red-fruit flavors at the base. Candied and fairly weak on the finish.
title: Simone 2007 Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Aromas of grapefruit skins and iodine open this wine A flat palate and baked red-fruit flavors with bitterness end full and grabby.
title: Almacruz 2016 Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Herbal, spicy aromas are strange, like uncooked hot dogs. This is plump on the palate, with flavors of spiced tomato and little more. A grabby finish lacks refinement.
title: Junta 2016 Momentos Reserve Pinot Noir (Itata Valley)

description: Applesauce aromas come with a note of sugar-coated beignet. This feels a little sticky, while scattershot flavors of grapefruit juice, lychee, mango and lime finish sweet but also green.
title: Undurraga NV Brut  (Central Valley)

description: Scattershot aromas are gritty and sweaty. This feels full but rather flat. Bland, sulfuric flavors of green fruits and melon finish short, with an oily texture.
title: Casa Silva 2016 1912 Vines Sauvignon Gris (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of spicy but sticky ripe black fruits feed into a creamy, almost gooey palate. Notes of clove, cinnamon and brown sugar are amplified alongside candied, jammy berry flavors.
title: Monkey Tree 2015 Red (Loncomilla Valley)

description: Aromas of spicy but sticky ripe black fruits feed into a creamy, almost gooey palate. Notes of clove, cinnamon and brown sugar are amplified alongside candied, jammy berry flavors.
title: Monkey Tree 2015 Red (Loncomilla Valley)

description: Milk chocolate and brambly berry aromas leads to a jammy, reduced palate that doesn't come across as entirely dry. Saturated candied berry flavors finish sweet, chewy and a bit hot.
title: Santa Ema 2015 Barrel Select 60/40 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Dark, muscular and concentrated, with char, rubber and blackberry aromas. Thick but not soupy, with big tannins and firm acids. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and dark plum are drawn, leaving an oaky, minty finish. A good but arguably overextracted organic Shiraz.
title: Caliterra 2009 Bio-Sur Shiraz (Colchagua Valley)

description: Standard value-priced Chilean Syrah in that it's herbal and leafy on the nose, with a mix of olive, earth, spice and dried red fruit aromas. The palate is a bit stretched out and tannic, while the flavor profile is pure olive, herbs and dried cherry. Finishes solid but herbal.
title: Veo 2008 Ultima Reserve Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: More herbal and plodding than prior vintages, with slightly pickled, briney flavors of blackberry, plum, olive and cough drop. Good in the mouth, with proper size and balance. Finishes a little green and peppery, but that's Carmenère, folks, like it or leave it.
title: Odfjell 2009 Armador Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: A bit sharp and rubbery at first, with herbal, floral, berry aromas rising up in due time. The palate is a little rigid, with angular acidity and semitart raspberry and red currant flavors. Lightly toasted on the finish even if there's not much oak on this regular, competent CS.
title: Odfjell 2009 Armador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A bit sharp and rubbery at first, with herbal, floral, berry aromas rising up in due time. The palate is a little rigid, with angular acidity and semitart raspberry and red currant flavors. Lightly toasted on the finish even if there's not much oak on this regular, competent CS.
title: Odfjell 2009 Armador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Big, oaky and roasted up front, with charred aromas. The palate is full but clacky, with piercing acidity leading to a saucy, sharp set of tangy red berry and herb flavors. There's a chocolaty element to smooth things out on the finish, but it's always snappy and sheer.
title: Morandé 2008 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: A little sharp smelling, with earth, leafiness and rubbery aromas. In the mouth, it's round and fairly balanced, with juicy acidity and herbal-olive flavors along with blackberry. Dark and herbal on the finish.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Firm, earth and berry fruits come with nuances of grass and green herbs. The palate feels grabby and raw yet settles into plum, berry, green herb and spice flavors that finish fresh and quick.
title: Maquis 2012 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Max Reserva is the easiest, most fruity of the Errazuriz Chardonnay lineup for 2014. Aromas of vanilla wafer, barrel toast, smoke and white fruits announce a smooth but simple palate. Peach, melon and toasty oak are the key flavors, while this finishes a touch salty.
title: Errazuriz 2014 Max Reserva Chardonnay (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Max Reserva is the easiest, most fruity of the Errazuriz Chardonnay lineup for 2014. Aromas of vanilla wafer, barrel toast, smoke and white fruits announce a smooth but simple palate. Peach, melon and toasty oak are the key flavors, while this finishes a touch salty.
title: Errazuriz 2014 Max Reserva Chardonnay (Aconcagua Costa)

description: This hefty but sluggish Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend opens with forceful aromas of earthy, herbal red-berry fruits and sweet oak. Chunky, thick and almost syrupy in feel, this tastes of herbal plum and spiced berry fruits. The longer it rests, the fatter and chunkier it gets. This warm-vintage has weight issues.
title: San Pedro 2012 Sideral Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: This hefty but sluggish Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend opens with forceful aromas of earthy, herbal red-berry fruits and sweet oak. Chunky, thick and almost syrupy in feel, this tastes of herbal plum and spiced berry fruits. The longer it rests, the fatter and chunkier it gets. This warm-vintage has weight issues.
title: San Pedro 2012 Sideral Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Smoky aromas of burning hickory are matched by lemon peel and earthy berry scents. This is a rubbery feeling wine, with grabby tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis and rubber suggest plastic. On the finish, lactic oak wrestles with a residual hint of green.
designation: Toro de Piedra Gran Reserva Single Vineyard
title: Viña Requingua 2011 Toro de Piedra Gran Reserva Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Smoky aromas of burning hickory are matched by lemon peel and earthy berry scents. This is a rubbery feeling wine, with grabby tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis and rubber suggest plastic. On the finish, lactic oak wrestles with a residual hint of green.
designation: Toro de Piedra Gran Reserva Single Vineyard
title: Viña Requingua 2011 Toro de Piedra Gran Reserva Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Minty, leathery berry fruit aromas are herbal and foresty. This is flush and solid in feel, with controlled tannins. Roasted, herbal black plum and berry flavors are what you'd expect from Colchagua Valley Carmenère, while this feels meaty and tastes blackened on the finish.
title: Casa Silva 2015 Los Lingues Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Strong but pleasant oak-based aromas of sandalwood complement lightly herbal plum and berry notes. This feels wiry and intense, with rugged tannins. Herbal, oaky berry flavors finish with scratchy tannins and a distant note of green.
designation: Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard
title: Agustinos 2015 Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard Malbec (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Strong but pleasant oak-based aromas of sandalwood complement lightly herbal plum and berry notes. This feels wiry and intense, with rugged tannins. Herbal, oaky berry flavors finish with scratchy tannins and a distant note of green.
designation: Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard
title: Agustinos 2015 Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard Malbec (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Blackberry, prune and pencil eraser aromas are oaky and forced. A heavy, grabby palate with noticeable oak resin delivers chocolaty, oaky berry flavors that taste a bit artificial. In the grand scheme of things, this is more than fair for the price; but prior years were better.
title: Santa Rita 2013 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A chunky, raisiny bouquet shouts maxium ripeness, while in the mouth this borders on syrupy while pumping out the volume. Jammy flavors of boysenberry and prune finish with fig and chocolate flvaors. This is dark and rich but pushing up against overripe.
title: Indomita 2011 Zardoz Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Crusty berry aromas are toasty and tarry. This feels flush and solid, with good body and structure. On the palate, this tastes fresh and lightly herbal, with spiced berry as the core flavor. A minty, lightly toasted and spicy finish provides a nice ending
title: Veramonte 2011 El Caballero Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Olive, herbs and baked berry aromas vie with slightly stemmy scents to create a good but compromised bouquet. The palate has a full feel and juiciness along with medicinal cherry and berry flavors. Finishes toasty, baked and somewhat sharp and herbal.
title: Meli 2008 Carignan (Maule Valley)

description: Other than a slightly burnt and stemmy nose, this is a nice Chilean Pinot. The bouquet deals tea, raspberry and crushed leaves, but as stated, also some burned rhubarb. Feels slightly syrupy and thick, with baked, herbal flavors of raspberry and strawberry. Falls off on the finish, where a bit of green enters the picture.
title: Leyda 2009 Lot 21 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Meaty and roasted on the nose, with rubbery plum and blackberry aromas. This is a full-force wine with clacky, firm tannins and herbal flavors of cassis and dark berry. Finishes roasted, with an herbal character. Lively but coarse feeling.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2009 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Rapel Valley)

description: Salinic and also melony on the mostly clean and crisp nose. The palate is healthy, with round, lightly pithy flavors of green melon, peach and kiwi. Citrusy on the finish and a little green on the fade out. Good for summer quaffing. Drink this year.
title: Yali 2010 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

description: Mildly tropical on the nose and pleasant overall, with a touch of match stick to the bouquet. The palate is lemony and sheer, with flavors of Meyer lemon, white peach and apple. Pointed on the finish but clean. Good but normal in the scheme of things.
title: Vistamar 2010 Sepia Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Pithy and citrusy on the nose, but ultimately it's rather neutral. The palate is citric and lean, with orange, lemon and sour apple flavors. Zesty to the point of tartness, with a citrusy, juicy finish. A pointed SB with zing.
title: Emiliana 2010 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a very oaky, powerful wine, with minty aromas of shoe polish, blackened toast and herbs. It's full and creamy on one hand, but bold and tannic on the other. Dark, medicinal black-fruit flavors are followed by oak-driven mocha and buttery notes, while the finish tastes downright buttery at one moment, then dark, ripe and fruity the next. Drink through 2021.
title: François Lurton 2012 Hacienda Araucano Alka Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: With an opaque purple tint and brawny, gaseous aromas of raw oak, bacon, black olive and blackberry, this old-vine Cabernet is blocky, tannic and bullish. Intense, toasty flavors of herbal blackberry and baked plum finish muscular, blackened, herbal and a touch bitter. Best from 2017–2022.
title: Miguel Torres 2010 Manso de Velasco Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: With an opaque purple tint and brawny, gaseous aromas of raw oak, bacon, black olive and blackberry, this old-vine Cabernet is blocky, tannic and bullish. Intense, toasty flavors of herbal blackberry and baked plum finish muscular, blackened, herbal and a touch bitter. Best from 2017–2022.
title: Miguel Torres 2010 Manso de Velasco Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: Fresh aromas of stony minerals, white grapefruit and passion fruit are a proper opening for a zesty, cutting palate that's loaded to the brink with citric acidity. Flavors of wet stones, lime, lemon and green apple finish long, zesty and without a stumble.
title: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Berry, olive, spice and herbal aromas are typical of Chilean Cabernet. Scratchy tannins and medium overall weight make for some roughness, while raspberry and red-plum flavors finish herbal and spicy.
title: Carmen 2012 Gran Reserva Maipo Alto Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Apple, melon, spice and briny aromas are more mellow than loud. This feels fresh and focused, but simple. Flavors of white peach, melon and nuts carry onto the finish, with a hint of popcorn flavor.
title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Ripe, jammy blueberry and blackberry aromas come with a hint of graphite and sweet-smelling oak. This is choppy and edgy in feel, with coconut, blackberry and tart, drawing flavors.
title: Calcu 2012 Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: Powdered sugar and other lightly confected aromas set up more steely apple and pineapple flavors. Finishes pithy, with grapefruit. Drying and short, but still a reasonable facsimile of Champagne.
title: Viña La Rosa NV Brut Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: This small-production blend of Carmenère, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah is deep, layered and exciting. The nose is creamy but diligent, with plum, cassis, chocolate and a touch of popcorn coming from the oak. The palate is smooth and healthy, with cassis, cherry, plum, tobacco and herb flavors in front of a bright, alert, cola-driven finish. Really good for a Chilean blend. 500 cases produced.
title: Viña Santa Cruz 2006 Tupu Edicion Limitada Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Blackberry aromas along with minerally vitamin notes open this fresh lean angular Cabernet from western Colchagua. Choppy currant and plum flavors are dry and spicy, while this finishes with herbal red-fruit flavors, spice and chocolate notes.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca
title: Concha y Toro 2014 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca Cabernet Sauvignon (Marchigue)

description: Blackberry aromas along with minerally vitamin notes open this fresh lean angular Cabernet from western Colchagua. Choppy currant and plum flavors are dry and spicy, while this finishes with herbal red-fruit flavors, spice and chocolate notes.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca
title: Concha y Toro 2014 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca Cabernet Sauvignon (Marchigue)

description: Popcorn and white-fruit aromas are toasty, nutty and appropriate. This is zesty and well-cut across the palate. Flavors of apple, peach, papaya and buttered movie popcorn finish oaky, briny and elegant, with a chiseled, acid-driven feel.
title: Errazuriz 2013 Aconcagua Costa Chardonnay (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Complexity on the nose comes via earthy aromas of licorice root, sandalwood and mild berry fruits. The palate is on the big and bullish side, but it's neither heavy nor fierce. Flavors of ripe blackberry, pepper and chocolate finish with a touch of herbs and mint. Drink through 2017.
title: Concha y Toro 2011 Marques de Casa Concha Syrah (Buin)

description: Six grapes led by Cabernet Sauvignon have been blended into Lazuli, which starts out spicy and herbal. The palate is lively and juicy, with good overall feel. Peppery notes accent roasted berry flavors, while the finish delivers a strong spine and salty, herbal notes that are complex.
title: Chilensis 2010 Lazuli Red (Maule Valley)

description: Fairly neutral on the nose, but clean and easy to get into. The palate offers good acidity and vitality for Maule SB, with tropical fruit leading the flavor profile followed by pithy green notes. Overall this is a good value white.
title: Viña Requingua 2010 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Berry aromas, herbal scents and leafiness dot the nose on this fresh, fairly standard Cabernet. The palate has a juicy, fresh feel and then medium-weight flavors of berry and plum mixed with mocha. Finishes slightly sweet and medicinal.
title: Echeverria 2008 Family Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
